verses.en: From this man's descendants God has brought to Israel the Savior Jesus, as he promised.

verses.zh: 在他没有出来以先，约翰已经向以色列众民宣讲悔改的洗礼。
verses.en: Before the coming of Jesus, John preached repentance and baptism to all the people of Israel.

verses.zh: 约翰将行尽他的程途的时候，说：你们以为我是谁？我不是基督；只是有一位在我以后来的，我就是给他解鞋带也不配。
verses.en: As John was completing his work, he said: 'Who do you suppose I am? I am not the one you are looking for. But there is one coming after me whose sandals I am not worthy to untie.'

verses.zh: 弟兄们，亚伯拉罕的子孙和一切在你们中间敬畏神的人哪，这救恩之道是传给我们的。
verses.en: Fellow children of Abraham and you God-fearing Gentiles, it is to us that this message of salvation has been sent.

verses.zh: 耶路撒冷居住的人和他们的官长，因为不认识基督，也不明白每安息日所读众先知的书，就把基督定了死罪，正应了先知的预言。
verses.en: The people of Jerusalem and their rulers did not recognize Jesus, yet in condemning him they fulfilled the words of the prophets that are read every Sabbath.

verses.zh: 虽然查不出他有当死的罪，却求彼拉多杀他。
verses.en: Though they found no proper ground for a death sentence, they asked Pilate to have him executed.

verses.zh: 既成就了经上指着他所写的一切话，就把他从木头上取下来，放在坟墓里。
verses.en: When they had carried out all that was written about him, they took him down from the cross and laid him in a tomb.

verses.zh: 神却叫他从死里复活。
verses.en: But God raised him from the dead,

verses.zh: 那从加利利同他上耶路撒冷的人多日看见他，这些人如今在民间是他的见证。
verses.en: and for many days he was seen by those who had traveled with him from Galilee to Jerusalem. They are now his witnesses to our people.

verses.zh: 我们也报好信息给你们，就是那应许祖宗的话，
verses.en: We tell you the good news: What God promised our ancestors

verses.zh: 神已经向我们这作儿女的应验，叫耶稣复活了。正如诗篇第二篇上记着说：你是我的儿子，我今日生你。
verses.en: he has fulfilled for us, their children, by raising up Jesus. As it is written in the second Psalm: 'You are my son; today I have become your father.'

verses.zh: 论到神叫他从死里复活，不再归于朽坏，就这样说：我必将所应许大卫那圣洁可靠的恩典，赐给你们。
verses.en: God raised him from the dead so that he will never be subject to decay. As God has said, 'I will give you the holy and sure blessings promised to David.'

verses.zh: 又在另一篇上说：你必不叫你的圣者见朽坏。
verses.en: So it is also stated elsewhere: 'You will not let your holy one see decay.'

verses.zh: 大卫在世的时候，遵行了神的旨意，就睡了，归到他祖宗那里，已见朽坏。
verses.en: Now when David had served God's purpose in his own generation, he fell asleep; he was buried with his ancestors and his body decayed.

verses.zh: 惟独神所复活的，他并未见朽坏。
verses.en: But the one whom God raised from the dead did not see decay.

verses.zh: 所以弟兄们，你们当晓得：赦罪的道是由这人传给你们的。
verses.en: Therefore, my friends, I want you to know that through Jesus the forgiveness of sins is proclaimed to you.

verses.zh: 你们靠摩西的律法，在一切不得称义的事上，也都靠这人称义了。
verses.en: Through him everyone who believes is set free from every sin, a justification you were not able to obtain under the law of Moses.

verses.zh: 所以你们务要小心，免得先知书上所说的话临到你们。
verses.en: Take care that what the prophets have said does not happen to you:

verses.zh: 主说：你们这轻慢的人要观看，要惊奇，要灭亡。因为在你们的时候，我行一件事，虽有人告诉你们，你们总是不信。
verses.en: Look, you scoffers, wonder and perish, for I am going to do something in your days that you would never believe, even if someone told you.

verses.zh: 他们出会堂的时候，众人请他们到下安息日再讲这话给他们听。
verses.en: As Paul and Barnabas were leaving the synagogue, the people invited them to speak further about these things on the next Sabbath.

verses.zh: 散会以后，犹太人和敬虔进犹太教的人，多有跟从保罗、巴拿巴的。他们又对他们讲论，说：你们必须恒久在神的恩中。
verses.en: When the congregation was dismissed, many of the Jews and devout converts to Judaism followed Paul and Barnabas, who talked with them and urged them to continue in the grace of God.

verses.zh: 到下安息日，全城的人几乎都来聚集，要听神的道。
verses.en: On the next Sabbath almost the whole city gathered to hear the word of the Lord.

verses.zh: 但犹太人看见人这样多，就满心嫉妒，硬驳保罗所说的话，并且毁谤。
verses.en: When the Jews saw the crowds, they were filled with jealousy. They began to contradict what Paul was saying and heaped abuse on him.

verses.zh: 保罗和巴拿巴放胆说：神的道先讲给你们原是应当的；只因你们弃绝这道，断定自己不配得永生，我们就转向外邦人去。
verses.en: Then Paul and Barnabas answered them boldly: We had to speak the word of God to you first. Since you reject it and do not consider yourselves worthy of eternal life, we now turn to the Gentiles.

verses.zh: 因为主曾这样吩咐我们说：'我已经立你作外邦人的光，叫你施行救恩，直到地极。'
verses.en: For this is what the Lord has commanded us: 'I have made you a light for the Gentiles, that you may bring salvation to the ends of the earth.'

verses.zh: 在以哥念，他们同进犹太人的会堂，在那里讲的，叫犹太人和希腊人信的很多。
verses.en: At Iconium Paul and Barnabas went as usual into the Jewish synagogue. There they spoke so effectively that a great number of Jews and Greeks believed.

verses.zh: 但那不顺从的犹太人耸动外邦人，叫他们心里恼恨弟兄。
verses.en: But the Jews who refused to believe stirred up the other Gentiles and poisoned their minds against the brothers.

verses.zh: 二人在那里住了多日，倚靠主放胆讲道，主借他们的手施行神迹奇事，证明他的恩道。
verses.en: So Paul and Barnabas spent considerable time there, speaking boldly for the Lord, who confirmed the message of his grace by enabling them to perform signs and wonders.

verses.zh: 城里的众人就分了党，有附从犹太人的，有附从使徒的。
verses.en: The people of the city were divided; some sided with the Jews, others with the apostles.

verses.zh: 后来外邦人和犹太人，并他们的官长，一齐拥上来，要凌辱使徒，用石头打他们。
verses.en: There was a plot afoot among both Gentiles and Jews, together with their leaders, to mistreat them and stone them.

verses.zh: 使徒知道了，就逃往吕高尼的路司得、特庇两个城和周围地方去。
verses.en: But they found out about it and fled to the Lycaonian cities of Lystra and Derbe and to the surrounding country,

verses.zh: 在那里传福音。
verses.en: where they continued to preach the gospel.

verses.zh: 路司得城里坐着一个两脚无力的人，生来是瘸腿的，从来没有走过。
verses.en: In Lystra there sat a man who was lame. He had been that way from birth and had never walked.

verses.zh: 他听保罗讲道，保罗定睛看他，见他有信心，可得痊愈，
verses.en: He listened to Paul as he was speaking. Paul looked directly at him, saw that he had faith to be healed

verses.zh: 就大声说：你起来，两脚站直。他就跳起来而且行走。
verses.en: and called out, Stand up on your feet! At that, the man jumped up and began to walk.

verses.zh: 众人看见保罗所做的事，就用吕高尼的话大声说：有神借着人形降临在我们中间了。
verses.en: When the crowd saw what Paul had done, they shouted in the Lycaonian language, The gods have come down to us in human form!

verses.zh: 他们称巴拿巴为丢斯，称保罗为希耳米，因为他说话领首。
verses.en: Barnabas they called Zeus, and Paul they called Hermes because he was the chief speaker.

verses.zh: 有城外丢斯庙的祭司牵着牛，拿着花圈，来到门前，要同众人向使徒献祭。
verses.en: The priest of Zeus, whose temple was just outside the city, brought bulls and wreaths to the city gates because he and the crowd wanted to offer sacrifices to them.

verses.zh: 巴拿巴、保罗二使徒听见，就撕开衣裳，跳进众人中间，喊着说：
verses.en: But when the apostles Barnabas and Paul heard of this, they tore their clothes and rushed out into the crowd, shouting:

verses.zh: 诸君，为什么做这事呢？我们也是人，性情和你们一样。我们传福音给你们，是叫你们离弃这些虚妄，归向那创造天、地、海和其中万物的永生神。
verses.en: Friends, why are you doing this? We too are only human, like you. We are bringing you good news, telling you to turn from these worthless things to the living God, who made the heavens and the earth and the sea and everything in them.

verses.zh: 他在从前的世代，任凭万国各行其道。
verses.en: In the past, he let all nations go their own way.

verses.zh: 然而为自己未尝不显出证据来，就如常施恩惠，从天降雨，赏赐丰年，叫你们饮食饱足，满心喜乐。
verses.en: Yet he has not left himself without testimony: He has shown kindness by giving you rain from heaven and crops in their seasons; he provides you with plenty of food and fills your hearts with joy.

verses.zh: 二人说了这些话，仅仅地拦住众人不献祭与他们。
verses.en: Even with these words, they had difficulty keeping the crowd from sacrificing to them.

verses.zh: 但有些犹太人从安提阿和以哥念来，挑唆众人，就用石头打保罗，以为他死了，便拖到城外。
verses.en: Then some Jews came from Antioch and Iconium and won the crowd over. They stoned Paul and dragged him outside the city, thinking he was dead.

verses.zh: 门徒正围着他，他就起来，走进城去。第二天，同巴拿巴往特庇去。
verses.en: But after the disciples had gathered around him, he got up and went back into the city. The next day he and Barnabas left for Derbe.

verses.zh: 对那城传了福音，使好些人作门徒，就回路司得、以哥念、安提阿去。
verses.en: They preached the gospel in that city and won a large number of disciples. Then they returned to Lystra, Iconium and Antioch,

verses.zh: 坚固门徒的心，劝他们恒守所信的道，又说：我们进入神的国，必须经历许多艰难。
verses.en: strengthening the disciples and encouraging them to remain true to the faith. We must go through many hardships to enter the kingdom of God, they said.

verses.zh: 二人在各教会中选立了长老，又禁食祷告，就把他们交托所信的主。
verses.en: Paul and Barnabas appointed elders for them in each church and, with prayer and fasting, committed them to the Lord, in whom they had put their trust.

verses.zh: 二人经过彼西底，来到旁非利亚。
verses.en: After going through Pisidia, they came into Pamphylia,

verses.zh: 在别加讲了道，就下亚大利去。
verses.en: and when they had preached the word in Perga, they went down to Attalia.

verses.zh: 从那里坐船往安提阿去。当初他们被众人交托神的恩典，去做现在所成全的事工。
verses.en: From Attalia they sailed back to Antioch, where they had been committed to the grace of God for the work they had now completed.

verses.zh: 到了那里，聚集了会众，就述说神借他们所行的一切事，和神怎样为外邦人开了信道的门。
verses.en: On arriving there, they gathered the church together and reported all that God had done through them and how he had opened a door of faith to the Gentiles.

verses.zh: 他们就和门徒同住了多日。
verses.en: And they stayed there a long time with the disciples.

verses.zh: 有几个人从犹太下来，教训弟兄们说：你们若不按摩西的规条受割礼，不能得救。
verses.en: Certain people came down from Judea to Antioch and were teaching the believers: Unless you are circumcised, according to the custom taught by Moses, you cannot be saved.

verses.zh: 保罗、巴拿巴与他们大大地分争辩论，众门徒就定规，叫保罗、巴拿巴和本会中几个人，为所辩论的，上耶路撒冷去见使徒和长老。
verses.en: This brought Paul and Barnabas into sharp dispute and debate with them. So Paul and Barnabas were appointed, along with some other believers, to go up to Jerusalem to see the apostles and elders about this question.

verses.zh: 于是教会送他们起行。他们经过腓尼基、撒玛利亚，随处传说外邦人归主的事，叫众弟兄都甚欢喜。
verses.en: The church sent them on their way, and as they traveled through Phoenicia and Samaria, they told how the Gentiles had been converted. This news made all the believers very glad.

verses.zh: 到了耶路撒冷，教会和使徒并长老都接待他们，他们就述说神同他们所行的一切事。
verses.en: When they came to Jerusalem, they were welcomed by the church and the apostles and elders, to whom they reported everything God had done through them.

verses.zh: 惟有几个信徒是法利赛教门的人，起来说：必须给外邦人行割礼，吩咐他们遵守摩西的律法。
verses.en: Then some of the believers who belonged to the party of the Pharisees stood up and said, The Gentiles must be circumcised and required to keep the law of Moses.

verses.zh: 使徒和长老聚会商议这事。
verses.en: The apostles and elders met to consider this question.

verses.zh: 辩论已经多了，彼得起来，说：诸位弟兄，你们知道神早已在你们中间拣选了我，叫外邦人从我口中得着福音之道，而且相信。
verses.en: After much discussion, Peter got up and addressed them: Brothers, you know that some time ago God made a choice among you that the Gentiles might hear from my lips the message of the gospel and believe.

verses.zh: 知道人心的神也为他们作了见证，赐圣灵给他们，正如给我们一样。
verses.en: God, who knows the heart, showed that he accepted them by giving the Holy Spirit to them, just as he did to us.

verses.zh: 又借着信洁净了他们的心，并不分他们我们。
verses.en: He did not discriminate between us and them, for he purified their hearts by faith.

verses.zh: 现在为什么试探神，要把我们祖宗和我们所不能负的轭，放在门徒的颈项上呢？
verses.en: Now then, why do you try to test God by putting on the necks of Gentiles a yoke that neither we nor our ancestors have been able to bear?

verses.zh: 我们得救，乃是因主耶稣的恩，和他们一样，这是我们所信的。
verses.en: No! We believe it is through the grace of our Lord Jesus that we are saved, just as they are.

verses.zh: 众人都默默无声，听巴拿巴和保罗述说神借他们在外邦人中所行的神迹奇事。
verses.en: The whole assembly became silent as they listened to Barnabas and Paul telling about the signs and wonders God had done among the Gentiles through them.

verses.zh: 他们住了声，雅各就说：诸位弟兄，请听我的话。
verses.en: When they finished, James spoke up. Brothers, he said, listen to me.

verses.zh: 方才西门述说神当初怎样眷顾外邦人，从他们中间选取百姓归于自己的名下。
verses.en: Simon has described to us how God first intervened to choose a people for his name from the Gentiles.

verses.zh: 众先知的话也与这意思相合。
verses.en: The words of the prophets are in agreement with this, as it is written:

verses.zh: 正如经上所写的：此后，我要回来，重新修造大卫倒塌的帐幕，把那破坏的重新修造建立起来。
verses.en: After this I will return and rebuild David's fallen tent. Its ruins I will rebuild, and I will restore it,

verses.zh: 叫余剩的人，就是凡称为我名下的外邦人，都寻求主。
verses.en: that the rest of mankind may seek the Lord, namely, all the Gentiles who bear my name, says the Lord, who does these things—

verses.zh: 这话是从创世以来显明这事的主说的。
verses.en: things known from long ago.

verses.zh: 所以据我的意见，不可难为那归服神的外邦人。
verses.en: It is my judgment, therefore, that we should not make it difficult for the Gentiles who are turning to God.

verses.zh: 只要写信吩咐他们，禁戒偶像的污秽和奸淫，并勒死的牲畜和血。
verses.en: Instead we should write to them, telling them to abstain from food polluted by idols, from sexual immorality, from the meat of strangled animals and from blood.

verses.zh: 因为从古以来，摩西的书在各城有人传讲，每逢安息日，在会堂里诵读。
verses.en: For the law of Moses has been preached in every city from the earliest times and is read in the synagogues on every Sabbath.

verses.zh: 那时，使徒和长老并全教会定意从他们中间拣选人，差他们和保罗、巴拿巴同往安提阿去。所拣选的就是称呼巴撒巴的犹大和西拉。这两个人在弟兄中是作首领的。
verses.en: Then the apostles and elders, with the whole church, decided to choose some of their own men and send them to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas. They chose Judas (called Barsabbas) and Silas, two men who were leaders among the believers.

verses.zh: 于是写信交付他们，内中说：使徒和作长老的弟兄们，问安提阿、叙利亚、基利家外邦众弟兄的安。
verses.en: With them they sent the following letter: The apostles and elders, your brothers, To the Gentile believers in Antioch, Syria and Cilicia: Greetings.

verses.zh: 我们听说有几个人从我们这里出去，用言语搅扰你们，惑乱你们的心。（有古卷在此有：你们必须受割礼，遵守摩西的律法）其实我们并没有吩咐他们。
verses.en: We have heard that some went out from us without our authorization and disturbed you, troubling your minds by what they said.

verses.zh: 所以我们同心定意，拣选几个人，差他们同我们所亲爱的巴拿巴和保罗往你们那里去。
verses.en: So we all agreed to choose some men and send them to you with our dear friends Barnabas and Paul—

verses.zh: 这二人是为我主耶稣基督的名不顾性命的。
verses.en: men who have risked their lives for the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.zh: 我们就差了犹大和西拉，他们也要亲口诉说这些事。
verses.en: Therefore we are sending Judas and Silas to confirm by word of mouth what we are writing.

verses.zh: 因为圣灵和我们定意不将别的重担放在你们身上，惟有几件事是不可少的，
verses.en: It seemed good to the Holy Spirit and to us not to burden you with anything beyond the following requirements:

verses.zh: 就是禁戒祭偶像之物和血，并勒死的牲畜和奸淫。这几件你们若能自己禁戒不犯，那就好了。愿你们平安。
verses.en: You are to abstain from food sacrificed to idols, from blood, from the meat of strangled animals and from sexual immorality. You will do well to avoid these things. Farewell.

verses.zh: 他们既奉了差遣，就下安提阿去，聚集众人，交付书信。
verses.en: So the men were sent off and went down to Antioch, where they gathered the church together and delivered the letter.

verses.zh: 众人念了，因为得安慰，就欢喜了。
verses.en: The people read it and were glad for its encouraging message.

verses.zh: 犹大和西拉也是先知，就用许多话劝勉弟兄，坚固他们。
verses.en: Judas and Silas, who themselves were prophets, said much to encourage and strengthen the believers.

verses.zh: 住了些日子，弟兄们打发他们平平安安地回到差遣他们的人那里去。（有古卷在此有：
verses.en: After spending some time there, they were sent off by the believers with the blessing of peace to return to those who had sent them.

verses.zh: 惟有西拉定意仍住在那里。）
verses.en: [But Silas decided to remain there.]

verses.zh: 但保罗和巴拿巴仍在安提阿教训人，传福音，与其余许多人一同作主工。
verses.en: Paul and Barnabas remained in Antioch, where they and many others taught and preached the word of the Lord.

verses.zh: 过了些日子，保罗对巴拿巴说：我们可以回到从前宣传主道的各城，看望弟兄们景况如何。
verses.en: Some time later Paul said to Barnabas, Let us go back and visit the believers in all the towns where we preached the word of the Lord and see how they are doing.

verses.zh: 巴拿巴有意要带称呼马可的约翰同去。
verses.en: Barnabas wanted to take John, also called Mark, with them,

verses.zh: 但保罗因为马可从前在旁非利亚离开他们，不和他们同去作工，就以为不可带他去。
verses.en: but Paul did not think it wise to take him, because he had deserted them in Pamphylia and had not continued with them in the work.

verses.zh: 于是二人起了争论，甚至彼此分张。巴拿巴带着马可，坐船往居比路去。
verses.en: They had such a sharp disagreement that they parted company. Barnabas took Mark and sailed for Cyprus,

verses.zh: 保罗拣选了西拉，也出去，蒙弟兄们把他交于主的恩中。
verses.en: but Paul chose Silas and left, commended by the believers to the grace of the Lord.

verses.zh: 他就走遍叙利亚、基利家，坚固众教会。
verses.en: He went through Syria and Cilicia, strengthening the churches.

verses.zh: 保罗来到特庇，又到路司得。在那里有一个门徒，名叫提摩太，是信主之犹太妇人的儿子，他父亲却是希腊人。
verses.en: Paul came to Derbe and then to Lystra, where a disciple named Timothy lived, whose mother was Jewish and a believer but whose father was a Greek.

verses.zh: 路司得和以哥念的弟兄都称赞他。
verses.en: The believers at Lystra and Iconium spoke well of him.

verses.zh: 保罗要带他同去，只因那些地方的犹太人，就给他行了割礼。因为人人都知道他父亲是希腊人。
verses.en: Paul wanted to take him along on the journey, so he circumcised him because of the Jews who lived in that area, for they all knew that his father was a Greek.

verses.zh: 他们经过各城，把耶路撒冷使徒和长老所定的条规交给门徒遵守。
verses.en: As they traveled from town to town, they delivered the decisions reached by the apostles and elders in Jerusalem for the people to obey.

verses.zh: 于是众教会信心越发坚固，人数天天增加。
verses.en: So the churches were strengthened in the faith and grew daily in numbers.

verses.zh: 圣灵既然禁止他们在亚西亚讲道，他们就经过弗吕家、加拉太一带地方。
verses.en: Paul and his companions traveled throughout the region of Phrygia and Galatia, having been kept by the Holy Spirit from preaching the word in the province of Asia.

verses.zh: 到了每西亚的边界，他们想要往庇推尼去，耶稣的灵却不许。
verses.en: When they came to the border of Mysia, they tried to enter Bithynia, but the Spirit of Jesus would not allow them to.

verses.zh: 他们就越过每西亚，下到特罗亚去。
verses.en: So they passed by Mysia and went down to Troas.

verses.zh: 在夜间有异象现与保罗。有一个马其顿人站着求他说：请你过到马其顿来帮助我们。
verses.en: During the night Paul had a vision of a man of Macedonia standing and begging him, Come over to Macedonia and help us.

verses.zh: 保罗既看见这异象，我们随即想要往马其顿去，以为神召我们传福音给他们。
verses.en: After Paul had seen the vision, we got ready at once to leave for Macedonia, concluding that God had called us to preach the gospel to them.

verses.zh: 于是从特罗亚开船，一直行到撒摩特喇，第二天到了尼亚波利。
verses.en: From Troas we put out to sea and sailed straight for Samothrace, and the next day we went on to Neapolis.

verses.zh: 从那里来到腓立比，就是马其顿这一方的头一个城，也是罗马的驻防城。我们在这城里住了几天。
verses.en: From there we traveled to Philippi, a Roman colony and the leading city of that district of Macedonia. And we stayed there several days.

verses.zh: 当安息日，我们出城门，到了河边，知道那里有一个祷告的地方，我们就坐下对那聚会的妇女讲道。
verses.en: On the Sabbath we went outside the city gate to the river, where we expected to find a place of prayer. We sat down and began to speak to the women who had gathered there.

verses.zh: 有一个卖紫色布匹的妇人，名叫吕底亚，是推雅推喇城的人，素来敬拜神。她听见了，主就开导她的心，叫她留心听保罗所讲的话。
verses.en: One of those listening was a woman from the city of Thyatira named Lydia, a dealer in purple cloth. She was a worshiper of God. The Lord opened her heart to respond to Paul's message.

verses.zh: 她和她一家既领了洗，便求我们说：你们若以为我是真信主的，请到我家里来住。于是强留我们。
verses.en: When she and the members of her household were baptized, she invited us to her home. If you consider me a believer in the Lord, she said, come and stay at my house. And she persuaded us.

verses.zh: 后来，我们往那祷告的地方去。有一个使女迎着面来，她被巫鬼所附，用法术叫她主人们大得财利。
verses.en: Once when we were going to the place of prayer, we were met by a female slave who had a spirit by which she predicted the future. She earned a great deal of money for her owners by fortune-telling.

verses.zh: 她跟随保罗和我们，喊着说：这些人是至高神的仆人，对你们传说救人的道。
verses.en: She followed Paul and the rest of us, shouting, These men are servants of the Most High God, who are telling you the way to be saved.

verses.zh: 她一连多日这样喊叫，保罗就心中厌烦，转身对那鬼说：我奉耶稣基督的名，吩咐你从她身上出来。那鬼当时就出来了。
verses.en: She kept this up for many days. Finally Paul became so annoyed that he turned around and said to the spirit, In the name of Jesus Christ I command you to come out of her! At that moment the spirit left her.

verses.zh: 使女的主人们见得利的指望没有了，便揪住保罗和西拉，拉他们到市上去见官。
verses.en: When her owners realized that their hope of making money was gone, they seized Paul and Silas and dragged them into the marketplace to face the authorities.

verses.zh: 又带到官长面前说：这些人原是犹太人，竟骚扰我们的城，
verses.en: They brought them before the magistrates and said, These men are Jews who are throwing our city into an uproar

verses.zh: 传我们罗马人所不可受不可行的规矩。
verses.en: by advocating customs unlawful for us Romans to accept or practice.

verses.zh: 众人就一同起来攻击他们。官长吩咐剥了他们的衣裳，用棍打。
verses.en: The crowd joined in the attack against Paul and Silas, and the magistrates ordered them to be stripped and beaten with rods.

verses.zh: 打了许多棍，便将他们下在监里，嘱咐禁卒严紧看守。
verses.en: After they had been severely flogged, they were thrown into prison, and the jailer was commanded to guard them carefully.

verses.zh: 禁卒领了这样的命，就把他们下在内监里，两脚上了木狗。
verses.en: When he received these orders, he put them in the inner cell and fastened their feet in the stocks.

verses.zh: 约在半夜，保罗和西拉祷告唱诗赞美神，众囚犯也侧耳而听。
verses.en: About midnight Paul and Silas were praying and singing hymns to God, and the other prisoners were listening to them.

verses.zh: 忽然，地大震动，甚至监牢的地基都摇动了，监门立刻全开，众囚犯的锁链也都松开了。
verses.en: Suddenly there was such a violent earthquake that the foundations of the prison were shaken. At once all the prison doors flew open, and everyone's chains came loose.

verses.zh: 禁卒一醒，看见监门全开，以为囚犯都逃走了，就拔刀要自杀。
verses.en: The jailer woke up, and when he saw the prison doors open, he drew his sword and was about to kill himself because he thought the prisoners had escaped.

verses.zh: 保罗大声呼叫说：不要伤害自己，我们都在这里。
verses.en: But Paul shouted, Don't harm yourself! We are all here!

verses.zh: 禁卒叫人拿灯来，就跳进去，战战兢兢地俯伏在保罗、西拉面前。
verses.en: The jailer called for lights, rushed in and fell trembling before Paul and Silas.

verses.zh: 又领他们出来，说：二位先生，我当怎样行才可以得救？
verses.en: He then brought them out and asked, Sirs, what must I do to be saved?

verses.zh: 他们说：当信主耶稣，你和你一家都必得救。
verses.en: They replied, Believe in the Lord Jesus, and you will be saved—you and your household.

verses.zh: 他们就把主的道讲给他和他全家的人听。
verses.en: Then they spoke the word of the Lord to him and to all the others in his house.

verses.zh: 当夜，就在那时候，禁卒把他们带去，洗他们的伤。他和属乎他的人即时都受了洗。
verses.en: At that hour of the night the jailer took them and washed their wounds; then immediately he and all his household were baptized.

verses.zh: 领他们上自己家里，设摆筵席，给他和全家的人欢欢喜喜地相信了神。
verses.en: The jailer brought them into his house and set a meal before them; he was filled with joy because he had come to believe in God—he and his whole household.

verses.zh: 到了天亮，官长打发差役来说：释放这两个人吧。
verses.en: When it was daylight, the magistrates sent their officers to the jailer with the order: Release those men.

verses.zh: 禁卒就把这话告诉保罗说：官长打发人来，叫释放你们，如今可以出监，平平安安地去吧。
verses.en: The jailer told Paul, The magistrates have ordered that you and Silas be released. Now you can leave. Go in peace.

verses.zh: 保罗却说：我们是罗马人，并没有定罪，他们就在众人面前打了我们，又把我们下在监里，现在要私下撵我们出去吗？这不行的。叫他们自己来领我们出去吧。
verses.en: But Paul said to the officers: They beat us publicly without a trial, even though we are Roman citizens, and threw us into prison. And now do they want to get rid of us quietly? No! Let them come themselves and escort us out.

verses.zh: 差役把这话回禀官长。官长听见他们是罗马人，就害怕了。
verses.en: The officers reported this to the magistrates, and when they heard that Paul and Silas were Roman citizens, they were alarmed.

verses.zh: 于是来劝他们，领他们出来，请他们离开那城。
verses.en: They came to appease them and escorted them from the prison, requesting them to leave the city.

verses.zh: 二人出了监，往吕底亚家里去。见了弟兄们，劝勉他们一番，就走了。
verses.en: After Paul and Silas came out of the prison, they went to Lydia's house, where they met with the brothers and sisters and encouraged them. Then they left.

verses.zh: 保罗和西拉经过暗妃波里、亚波罗尼亚，来到帖撒罗尼迦，在那里有犹太人的会堂。
verses.en: When Paul and his companions had passed through Amphipolis and Apollonia, they came to Thessalonica, where there was a Jewish synagogue.

verses.zh: 保罗照他素常的规矩进去，一连三个安息日，本着圣经与他们辩论，
verses.en: As was his custom, Paul went into the synagogue, and on three Sabbath days he reasoned with them from the Scriptures,

verses.zh: 讲解陈明基督必须受害，从死里复活，又说：我所传与你们的这位耶稣，就是基督。
verses.en: explaining and proving that the Messiah had to suffer and rise from the dead. This Jesus I am proclaiming to you is the Messiah, he said.

verses.zh: 他们中间有些人听了劝，就附从保罗和西拉，并有许多虔敬的希腊人，尊贵的妇女也不少。
verses.en: Some of the Jews were persuaded and joined Paul and Silas, as did a large number of God-fearing Greeks and quite a few prominent women.

verses.zh: 但那不信的犹太人心里嫉妒，招聚了些市井匪类，搭伙成群，耸动合城的人闯进耶孙的家，要将保罗、西拉带到百姓那里。
verses.en: But other Jews were jealous; so they rounded up some bad characters from the marketplace, formed a mob and started a riot in the city. They rushed to Jason's house in search of Paul and Silas in order to bring them out to the crowd.

verses.zh: 找不着他们，就把耶孙和几个弟兄拉到地方官那里，喊叫说：那搅乱天下的，也到这里来了。
verses.en: But when they did not find them, they dragged Jason and some other believers before the city officials. They shouted: These men who have caused trouble all over the world have now come here,

verses.zh: 耶孙收留了他们。这些人都违背凯撒的命令，说另有一个王耶稣。
verses.en: and Jason has welcomed them into his house. They are all defying Caesar's decrees, saying that there is another king, one called Jesus.

verses.zh: 众人和地方官听见这话，就惊慌了。
verses.en: When they heard this, the crowd and the city officials were thrown into turmoil.

verses.zh: 地方官取了耶孙和其余之人的保状，就释放了他们。
verses.en: Then they made Jason and the others post bond and let them go.

verses.zh: 弟兄们随即在夜间打发保罗和西拉往庇哩亚去。二人到了，就进入犹太人的会堂。
verses.en: As soon as it was night, the believers sent Paul and Silas away to Berea. On arriving there, they went to the Jewish synagogue.

verses.zh: 这地方的人贤于帖撒罗尼迦的人，甘心领受这道，天天考查圣经，要晓得这道是与不是。
verses.en: Now the Berean Jews were of more noble character than those in Thessalonica, for they received the message with great eagerness and examined the Scriptures every day to see if what Paul said was true.

verses.zh: 所以他们中间多有相信的，又有希腊尊贵的妇女，男子也不少。
verses.en: Many of the Jews believed, as did also a number of prominent Greek women and many Greek men.

verses.zh: 但帖撒罗尼迦的犹太人知道保罗又在庇哩亚传神的道，也就往那里去，耸动众人。
verses.en: But when the Jews in Thessalonica learned that Paul was preaching the word of God at Berea, some of them went there too and stirred up the crowds.

verses.zh: 当时弟兄们便打发保罗往海边去，西拉和提摩太仍住在庇哩亚。
verses.en: The believers immediately sent Paul to the coast, but Silas and Timothy stayed at Berea.

verses.zh: 送保罗的人带他到了雅典，既领了命令，叫西拉和提摩太速速到他这里来，就回去了。
verses.en: Those who escorted Paul brought him to Athens and then left with instructions for Silas and Timothy to join him as soon as possible.

verses.zh: 保罗在雅典等候他们的时候，看见满城都是偶像，就心里着急。
verses.en: While Paul was waiting for them in Athens, he was greatly distressed to see that the city was full of idols.

verses.zh: 于是他在会堂里与犹太人和虔敬的人辩论，又在市上天天与所遇见的人辩论。
verses.en: So he reasoned in the synagogue with both Jews and God-fearing Greeks, as well as in the marketplace day by day with those who happened to be there.

verses.zh: 还有以彼古罗和斯多亚两门的学士与他争论。有的说：这胡言乱语的要说什么？有的说：他似乎是传说外邦鬼神的。保罗传讲耶稣和复活的道，他们就说：这是很新的教训。
verses.en: A group of Epicurean and Stoic philosophers began to debate with him. Some of them asked, What is this babbler trying to say? Others remarked, He seems to be advocating foreign gods. They said this because Paul was preaching the good news about Jesus and the resurrection.

verses.zh: 他们就把他带到亚略巴古，说：你所讲的这新道，我们也可以知道吗？
verses.en: Then they took him and brought him to a meeting of the Areopagus, where they said to him, May we know what this new teaching is that you are presenting?

verses.zh: 因为你有些奇怪的事传到我们耳中，我们愿意知道这些事是什么意思。
verses.en: You are bringing some strange ideas to our ears, and we would like to know what they mean.

verses.zh: 原来雅典人和住在那里的客旅都没有别的事，只将新闻说说听听。
verses.en: All the Athenians and the foreigners who lived there spent their time doing nothing but talking about and listening to the latest ideas.

verses.zh: 保罗站在亚略巴古当中，说：众位雅典人哪，我看你们凡事很敬畏鬼神。
verses.en: Paul then stood up in the meeting of the Areopagus and said: People of Athens! I see that in every way you are very religious.

verses.zh: 我游行的时候，观看你们所敬拜的，遇见一座坛，上面写着：未识之神。你们所不认识而敬拜的，我现在告诉你们。
verses.en: For as I walked around and looked carefully at your objects of worship, I even found an altar with this inscription: TO AN UNKNOWN GOD. So you are ignorant of the very thing you worship—and this is what I am going to proclaim to you.

verses.zh: 创造宇宙和其中万物的神，既是天地的主，就不住人手所造的殿，
verses.en: The God who made the world and everything in it is the Lord of heaven and earth and does not live in temples built by human hands.

verses.zh: 也不用人手服侍，好像缺少什么；自己倒将生命、气息、万物，赐给万人。
verses.en: And he is not served by human hands, as if he needed anything. Rather, he himself gives everyone life and breath and everything else.

verses.zh: 他从一本造出万族的人，住在全地上，并且预先定准他们的年限和所住的疆界，
verses.en: From one man he made all the nations, that they should inhabit the whole earth; and he marked out their appointed times in history and the boundaries of their lands.

verses.zh: 要叫他们寻求神，或者可以揣摩而得，其实他离我们各人不远；
verses.en: God did this so that they would seek him and perhaps reach out for him and find him, though he is not far from any one of us.

verses.zh: 我们生活、动作、存留，都在乎他。就如你们作诗的，有人说：我们也是他所生的。
verses.en: For in him we live and move and have our being. As some of your own poets have said, We are his offspring.

verses.zh: 我们既是神所生的，就不当以为神的神性像人用手艺、心思所雕刻的金、银、石。
verses.en: Therefore since we are God's offspring, we should not think that the divine being is like gold or silver or stone—an image made by human design and skill.

verses.zh: 世人蒙昧无知的时候，神并不监察，如今却吩咐各处的人都要悔改。
verses.en: In the past God overlooked such ignorance, but now he commands all people everywhere to repent.

verses.zh: 因为他已经定了日子，要借着他所设立的人，按公义审判天下，并且叫他从死里复活，给万人作可信的凭据。
verses.en: For he has set a day when he will judge the world with justice by the man he has appointed. He has given proof of this to everyone by raising him from the dead.

verses.zh: 众人听见从死里复活的话，就有讥诮他的；又有人说：我们再听你讲这个吧。
verses.en: When they heard about the resurrection of the dead, some of them sneered, but others said, We want to hear you again on this subject.

verses.zh: 于是保罗从他们当中出去了。
verses.en: At that, Paul left the Council.

verses.zh: 但有几个人贴近他，相信了，其中有亚略巴古的官丢尼修，也有名叫大马哩的妇人，还有别人一同相信。
verses.en: Some of the people became followers of Paul and believed. Among them was Dionysius, a member of the Areopagus, also a woman named Damaris, and a number of others.

verses.zh: 这事以后，保罗离了雅典，来到哥林多。
verses.en: After this, Paul left Athens and went to Corinth.

verses.zh: 遇见一个犹太人，名叫亚居拉，他生在本都，因最近革老丢命犹太人都离开罗马，就带着妻百基拉，从意大利来。保罗就投奔了他们。
verses.en: There he met a Jew named Aquila, a native of Pontus, who had recently come from Italy with his wife Priscilla, because Claudius had ordered all Jews to leave Rome. Paul went to see them,

verses.zh: 他们本是制造帐棚为业。保罗因与他们同业，就和他们同住作工。
verses.en: and because he was a tentmaker as they were, he stayed and worked with them.

verses.zh: 每逢安息日，保罗在会堂里辩论，劝化犹太人和希腊人。
verses.en: Every Sabbath he reasoned in the synagogue, trying to persuade Jews and Greeks.

verses.zh: 西拉和提摩太从马其顿来的时候，保罗为道迫切，向犹太人证明耶稣是基督。
verses.en: When Silas and Timothy came from Macedonia, Paul devoted himself exclusively to preaching, testifying to the Jews that Jesus was the Messiah.

verses.zh: 他们既抗拒、毁谤，保罗就抖着衣裳，说：你们的罪归到你们自己头上，与我无干。从今以后，我要往外邦人那里去。
verses.en: But when they opposed Paul and became abusive, he shook out his clothes in protest and said to them, Your blood be on your own heads! I am innocent of it. From now on I will go to the Gentiles.

verses.zh: 于是离开那里，到了一个人的家中，这人名叫提多犹士都，是敬拜神的，他的家靠近会堂。
verses.en: Then Paul left the synagogue and went next door to the house of Titius Justus, a worshiper of God.

verses.zh: 管会堂的基利司布和全家都信了主。还有许多哥林多人听了，就相信受洗。
verses.en: Crispus, the synagogue leader, and his entire household believed in the Lord; and many of the Corinthians who heard Paul believed and were baptized.

verses.zh: 夜间，主在异象中对保罗说：不要怕，只管讲，不要闭口。
verses.en: One night the Lord spoke to Paul in a vision: Do not be afraid; keep on speaking, do not be silent.

verses.zh: 有我与你同在，必没有人下手害你，因为在这城里我有许多的百姓。
verses.en: For I am with you, and no one is going to attack and harm you, because I have many people in this city.

verses.zh: 保罗在那里住了一年零六个月，将神的道教训他们。
verses.en: So Paul stayed in Corinth for a year and a half, teaching them the word of God.

verses.zh: 到迦流作亚该亚方伯的时候，犹太人同心起来攻击保罗，拉他到公堂，
verses.en: While Gallio was proconsul of Achaia, the Jews of Corinth made a united attack on Paul and brought him to the place of judgment.

verses.zh: 说：这个人劝人不按着律法敬拜神。
verses.en: This man, they charged, is persuading the people to worship God in ways contrary to the law.

verses.zh: 保罗刚要开口，迦流就对犹太人说：你们这些犹太人哪，若是犯法或作恶的事，我理当耐性听你们。
verses.en: Just as Paul was about to speak, Gallio said to the Jews, If you Jews were making a complaint about some misdemeanor or serious crime, it would be reasonable for me to listen to you.

verses.zh: 但所争论的，若是关乎言语、名目，和你们的律法，你们自己去办吧！这样的事，我不愿意审问。
verses.en: But since it involves questions about words and names and your own law—settle the matter yourselves. I will not be a judge of such things.

verses.zh: 就把他们撵出公堂。
verses.en: So he drove them off.

verses.zh: 众人便揪住管会堂的所提尼，在堂前打他。这些事迦流都不管。
verses.en: Then the crowd there turned on Sosthenes the synagogue leader and beat him in front of the proconsul; and Gallio showed no concern whatever.

verses.zh: 保罗又住了多日，就辞别了弟兄们，坐船往叙利亚去。百基拉、亚居拉和他同去。他因为许过愿，就在坚革哩剪了头发。
verses.en: Paul stayed on in Corinth for some time. Then he left the brothers and sisters and sailed for Syria, accompanied by Priscilla and Aquila. Before he sailed, he had his hair cut off at Cenchreae because of a vow he had taken.

verses.zh: 到了以弗所，保罗就把他们留在那里，自己进了会堂，和犹太人辩论。
verses.en: They arrived at Ephesus, where Paul left Priscilla and Aquila. He himself went into the synagogue and reasoned with the Jews.

verses.zh: 众人请他多住些日子，他却不允，
verses.en: When they asked him to spend more time with them, he declined.

verses.zh: 就辞别他们，说：神若许我，我还要回到你们这里。于是开船离了以弗所。
verses.en: But as he left, he promised, I will come back if it is God's will. Then he set sail from Ephesus.

verses.zh: 在凯撒利亚下了船，就上耶路撒冷去问教会安，然后下安提阿去。
verses.en: When he landed at Caesarea, he went up to Jerusalem and greeted the church and then went down to Antioch.

verses.zh: 住了些日子，又离开那里，挨次经过加拉太和弗吕家地方，坚固众门徒。
verses.en: After spending some time in Antioch, Paul set out from there and traveled from place to place throughout the region of Galatia and Phrygia, strengthening all the disciples.

verses.zh: 有一个犹太人，名叫亚波罗，来到以弗所。他生在亚力山太，是有学问的，最能讲解圣经。
verses.en: Meanwhile a Jew named Apollos, a native of Alexandria, came to Ephesus. He was a learned man, with a thorough knowledge of the Scriptures.

verses.zh: 这人已经在主的道上受了教训，心里火热，将耶稣的事详细讲论教训人，只是他单晓得约翰的洗礼。
verses.en: He had been instructed in the way of the Lord, and he spoke with great fervor and taught about Jesus accurately, though he knew only the baptism of John.

verses.zh: 他在会堂里放胆讲道。百基拉、亚居拉听见，就接他来，将神的道给他讲解更加详细。
verses.en: He began to speak boldly in the synagogue. When Priscilla and Aquila heard him, they invited him to their home and explained to him the way of God more adequately.

verses.zh: 他想要往亚该亚去，弟兄们就勉励他，并写信请门徒接待他。他到了那里，多帮助那些已经因恩相信的人。
verses.en: When Apollos wanted to go to Achaia, the brothers and sisters encouraged him and wrote to the disciples there to welcome him. When he arrived, he was a great help to those who by grace had believed.

verses.zh: 他在众人面前极有能力地驳倒犹太人，引圣经证明耶稣是基督。
verses.en: For he vigorously refuted his Jewish opponents in public debate, proving from the Scriptures that Jesus was the Messiah.

verses.zh: 亚波罗在哥林多的时候，保罗经过了上边一带地方，就来到以弗所，在那里遇见几个门徒。
verses.en: While Apollos was at Corinth, Paul took the road through the interior and arrived at Ephesus. There he found some disciples

verses.zh: 问他们说：你们信的时候，受了圣灵没有？他们回答说：没有，也未曾听见有圣灵赐下来。
verses.en: and asked them, Did you receive the Holy Spirit when you believed? They answered, No, we have not even heard that there is a Holy Spirit.

verses.zh: 又问他们说：这样，你们受的是什么洗呢？他们说：是约翰的洗。
verses.en: So Paul asked, Then what baptism did you receive? John's baptism, they replied.

verses.zh: 保罗说：约翰所行的是悔改的洗，告诉百姓，当信那在他以后要来的，就是耶稣。
verses.en: Paul said, John's baptism was a baptism of repentance. He told the people to believe in the one coming after him, that is, in Jesus.

verses.zh: 他们听见这话，就奉主耶稣的名受洗。
verses.en: On hearing this, they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.

verses.zh: 保罗按手在他们头上，圣灵便降在他们身上，他们就说方言，又说预言。
verses.en: When Paul placed his hands on them, the Holy Spirit came on them, and they spoke in tongues and prophesied.

verses.zh: 那一共约有十二个人。
verses.en: There were about twelve men in all.

verses.zh: 保罗进会堂，放胆讲道，一连三个月，辩论神国的事，劝化众人。
verses.en: Paul entered the synagogue and spoke boldly there for three months, arguing persuasively about the kingdom of God.

verses.zh: 后来，有些人心里刚硬不信，在众人面前毁谤这道，保罗就离开他们，也叫门徒与他们分离，便在推喇奴的学房天天辩论。
verses.en: But some of them became obstinate; they refused to believe and publicly maligned the Way. So Paul left them. He took the disciples with him and had discussions daily in the lecture hall of Tyrannus.

verses.zh: 这样有两年之久，叫一切住在亚西亚的，无论是犹太人，是希腊人，都听见主的道。
verses.en: This went on for two years, so that all the Jews and Greeks who lived in the province of Asia heard the word of the Lord.

verses.zh: 神借保罗的手行了些非常的奇事，
verses.en: God did extraordinary miracles through Paul,

verses.zh: 甚至有人从保罗身上拿手巾或围裙放在病人身上，疾病就退了，恶鬼也出去了。
verses.en: so that even handkerchiefs and aprons that had touched him were taken to the sick, and their illnesses were cured and the evil spirits left them.

verses.zh: 那时，有几个游行各处的犹太人，念咒赶鬼的，擅自对那被恶鬼附的人，称主耶稣的名，说：我奉保罗所传的耶稣，敕令你们出来。
verses.en: Some Jews who went around driving out evil spirits tried to invoke the name of the Lord Jesus over those who were demon-possessed. They would say, In the name of the Jesus whom Paul preaches, I command you to come out.

verses.zh: 作这事的，有犹太祭司长士基瓦的七个儿子。
verses.en: Seven sons of Sceva, a Jewish chief priest, were doing this.

verses.zh: 恶鬼回答他们说：耶稣我认识，保罗我也知道，你们却是谁呢？
verses.en: One day the evil spirit answered them, Jesus I know, and Paul I know about, but who are you?

verses.zh: 恶鬼所附的人就跳在他们身上，胜了其中二人，制伏他们，叫他们赤着身子受了伤，从那房子里逃出去了。
verses.en: Then the man who had the evil spirit jumped on them and overpowered them all. He gave them such a beating that they ran out of the house naked and bleeding.

verses.zh: 凡住在以弗所的，无论是犹太人，是希腊人，都知道这事，也都惧怕，主耶稣的名从此就尊大了。
verses.en: When this became known to the Jews and Greeks living in Ephesus, they were all seized with fear, and the name of the Lord Jesus was held in high honor.

verses.zh: 那已经相信的人，多有来承认诉说的。
verses.en: Many of those who believed now came and openly confessed what they had done.

verses.zh: 平素行邪术的，也有许多人把书拿来，堆积在众人面前焚烧。他们算计书价，便知道共合五万块钱。
verses.en: A number who had practiced sorcery brought their scrolls together and burned them publicly. When they calculated the value of the scrolls, the total came to fifty thousand drachmas.

verses.zh: 主的道大大兴旺，而且得胜，就是这样。
verses.en: In this way the word of the Lord spread widely and grew in power.

verses.zh: 这些事完了，保罗心里定意，经过了马其顿、亚该亚，就往耶路撒冷去。又说：我到了那里以后，也必须往罗马去看看。
verses.en: After all this had happened, Paul decided to go to Jerusalem, passing through Macedonia and Achaia. After I have been there, he said, I must visit Rome also.

verses.zh: 于是打发马其顿的两个帮手，提摩太和以拉都，先往马其顿去，自己暂时等在亚西亚。
verses.en: He sent two of his helpers, Timothy and Erastus, to Macedonia, while he stayed in the province of Asia a little longer.

verses.zh: 那时，因为这道起的扰乱不小。
verses.en: About that time there arose a great disturbance about the Way.

verses.zh: 有一个银匠，名叫底米丢，是制造亚底米神银龛的，他使这行手艺人生意发达。
verses.en: A silversmith named Demetrius, who made silver shrines of Artemis, brought in a lot of business for the craftsmen there.

verses.zh: 他聚集他们和同行的工人，说：众位，你们知道我们是靠这生意发财。
verses.en: He called them together, along with the workers in related trades, and said: You know, my friends, that we receive a good income from this business.

verses.zh: 这保罗不但在以弗所，也几乎在亚西亚全地，引诱迷惑许多人，说：人手所造的，不是神。这是你们所看见所听见的。
verses.en: And you see and hear how this fellow Paul has convinced and led astray large numbers of people here in Ephesus and in practically the whole province of Asia. He says that gods made by human hands are no gods at all.

verses.zh: 这样，不独我们这事业被人藐视，就是大女神亚底米的庙也要被人轻忽，连亚西亚全地和普天下所敬拜的大女神之荣耀也要消灭了。
verses.en: There is danger not only that our trade will lose its good name, but also that the temple of the great goddess Artemis will be discredited; and the goddess herself, who is worshiped throughout the province of Asia and the world, will be robbed of her divine majesty.

verses.zh: 众人听见，就怒气填胸，喊着说：大哉，以弗所人的亚底米啊！
verses.en: When they heard this, they were furious and began shouting: Great is Artemis of the Ephesians!

verses.zh: 满城都轰动起来。众人拿住与保罗同行的马其顿人该犹和亚里达古，齐心拥进戏园里去。
verses.en: Soon the whole city was in an uproar. The people seized Gaius and Aristarchus, Paul's traveling companions from Macedonia, and all of them rushed into the theater together.

verses.zh: 保罗想要进去见众人，门徒却不许他。
verses.en: Paul wanted to appear before the crowd, but the disciples would not let him.

verses.zh: 还有亚西亚几位首领，是保罗的朋友，打发人来劝他，不要冒险到戏园里去。
verses.en: Even some of the officials of the province, friends of Paul, sent him a message begging him not to venture into the theater.

verses.zh: 聚集的人纷纷乱乱，有喊叫这个的，有喊叫那个的，大半不知道是为什么聚集。
verses.en: The assembly was in confusion: Some were shouting one thing, some another. Most of the people did not even know why they were there.

verses.zh: 有人把亚力山大从众人中带出来，犹太人推他往前。亚力山大就摆手，要向百姓分诉。
verses.en: The Jews in the crowd pushed Alexander to the front, and they shouted instructions to him. He motioned for silence in order to make a defense before the people.

verses.zh: 只因他们认出他是犹太人，就大家同声喊叫，约有两小时，说：大哉，以弗所人的亚底米啊！
verses.en: But when they realized he was a Jew, they all shouted in unison for about two hours: Great is Artemis of the Ephesians!

verses.zh: 那城里的书记安抚了众人，就说：以弗所人哪，谁不知道以弗所人的城，是看守大亚底米庙和从宙斯那里落下来的像呢？
verses.en: The city clerk quieted the crowd and said: Fellow Ephesians, doesn't all the world know that the city of Ephesus is the guardian of the temple of the great Artemis and of her image, which fell from heaven?

verses.zh: 这事既是驳不倒的，你们就当安静，不可造次。
verses.en: Therefore, since these facts are undeniable, you ought to calm down and not do anything rash.

verses.zh: 你们把这些人带来，他们并没有偷窃庙中之物，也没有谤讟我们的女神。
verses.en: You have brought these men here, though they have neither robbed temples nor blasphemed our goddess.

verses.zh: 若是底米丢和他同行的人，有控告人的事，自有放告的日子，也有方伯可以彼此对告。
verses.en: If, then, Demetrius and his fellow craftsmen have a grievance against anybody, the courts are open and there are proconsuls. They can press charges.

verses.zh: 你们若问别的事，就可以照常例聚集断定。
verses.en: If there is anything further you want to bring up, it must be settled in a legal assembly.

verses.zh: 今日的扰乱，本是无缘无故，我们难免被查问。论到这样聚众，我们也说不出所以然来。
verses.en: As it is, we are in danger of being charged with rioting because of what happened today. In that case we would not be able to account for this commotion, since there is no reason for it.

verses.zh: 说了这话，便叫众人散去。
verses.en: After he had said this, he dismissed the assembly.

verses.zh: 乱定之后，保罗请门徒来，劝勉他们，就辞别起行，往马其顿去。
verses.en: When the uproar had ended, Paul sent for the disciples and, after encouraging them, said goodbye and set out for Macedonia.

verses.zh: 走遍了那一带地方，用许多话劝勉门徒，然后来到希腊。
verses.en: He traveled through that area, speaking many words of encouragement to the people, and finally arrived in Greece,

verses.zh: 在那里住了三个月，将要坐船往叙利亚去，犹太人设计要害他，他就定意从马其顿回去。
verses.en: where he stayed three months. Because some Jews had plotted against him just as he was about to sail for Syria, he decided to go back through Macedonia.

verses.zh: 同他到亚西亚去的，有庇哩亚人毕罗斯的儿子所巴特，帖撒罗尼迦人亚里达古和西公都，还有特庇人该犹，并提摩太，又有亚西亚人推基古和特罗非摩。
verses.en: He was accompanied by Sopater son of Pyrrhus from Berea, Aristarchus and Secundus from Thessalonica, Gaius from Derbe, Timothy also, and Tychicus and Trophimus from the province of Asia.

verses.zh: 这些人先走在特罗亚等候我们。
verses.en: These men went on ahead and waited for us at Troas.

verses.zh: 过了除酵节的日子，我们从腓立比开船，五天到了特罗亚，和他们相会，在那里住了七天。
verses.en: But we sailed from Philippi after the Festival of Unleavened Bread, and five days later joined the others at Troas, where we stayed seven days.

verses.zh: 七日的第一日，我们聚会擘饼的时候，保罗因为要次日起行，就与他们讲论，直讲到半夜。
verses.en: On the first day of the week we came together to break bread. Paul spoke to the people and, because he intended to leave the next day, kept on talking until midnight.

verses.zh: 我们聚会的屋子，上头有好些灯烛。
verses.en: There were many lamps in the upstairs room where we were meeting.

verses.zh: 有一个少年人，名叫犹推古，坐在窗台上，困倦沉睡。保罗讲了多时，少年人睡熟了，就从三层楼上掉下去，扶起来已经死了。
verses.en: Seated in a window was a young man named Eutychus, who was sinking into a deep sleep as Paul talked on and on. When he was sound asleep, he fell to the ground from the third story and was picked up dead.

verses.zh: 保罗下去，伏在他身上，抱着他，说：你们不要发慌，他的灵魂还在身上。
verses.en: Paul went down, threw himself on the young man and put his arms around him. Don't be alarmed, he said. He's alive!

verses.zh: 保罗又上去，擘饼，吃了，谈论许久，直到天亮，这才走了。
verses.en: Then he went upstairs again and broke bread and ate. After talking until daylight, he left.

verses.zh: 有人把那童子活活地领来，得的安慰不小。
verses.en: The people took the young man home alive and were greatly comforted.

verses.zh: 我们先上船开往亚朔去，意思要在那里接保罗，因为他是这样安排的，他自己打算步行。
verses.en: We went on ahead to the ship and sailed for Assos, where we were going to take Paul aboard. He had made this arrangement because he was going there on foot.

verses.zh: 他在亚朔与我们相会，我们就接他上船，来到米推利尼。
verses.en: When he met us at Assos, we took him aboard and went on to Mitylene.

verses.zh: 从那里开船，次日到了基阿的对面，又次日到了撒摩，又次日来到米利都。
verses.en: The next day we set sail from there and arrived opposite Chios. The day after that we crossed over to Samos, and on the following day arrived at Miletus.

verses.zh: 因为保罗早已定了主意，越过以弗所，免得在亚西亚耽延，他急忙前走，巴不得赶五旬节能到耶路撒冷。
verses.en: Paul had decided to sail past Ephesus to avoid spending time in the province of Asia, for he was in a hurry to reach Jerusalem, if possible, by the day of Pentecost.

verses.zh: 保罗从米利都打发人往以弗所去，请教会的长老来。
verses.en: From Miletus, Paul sent to Ephesus for the elders of the church.

verses.zh: 他们来了，保罗就说：你们知道，自从我到亚西亚的日子以来，我常与你们同在，
verses.en: When they arrived, he said to them: You know how I lived the whole time I was with you, from the first day I came into the province of Asia.

verses.zh: 怎样服侍主，凡事谦卑，眼中流泪，又因犹太人的谋害，经历试炼。
verses.en: I served the Lord with great humility and with tears and in the midst of severe testing by the plots of my Jewish opponents.

verses.zh: 你们也知道，凡与你们有益的，我没有一样避讳不说的，或在众人面前，或在各人家里，我都教导你们。
verses.en: You know that I have not hesitated to preach anything that would be helpful to you but have taught you publicly and from house to house.

verses.zh: 又对犹太人和希腊人，证明当向神悔改，信靠我主耶稣基督。
verses.en: I have declared to both Jews and Greeks that they must turn to God in repentance and have faith in our Lord Jesus.

verses.zh: 现在我往耶路撒冷去，心被捆绑，不知道在那里要遇见什么事。
verses.en: And now, compelled by the Spirit, I am going to Jerusalem, not knowing what will happen to me there.

verses.zh: 但知道圣灵在各城里向我指证，说有捆锁与患难等待我。
verses.en: I only know that in every city the Holy Spirit warns me that prison and hardships are facing me.

verses.zh: 我却不以性命为念，也不看为宝贵，只要行完我的路程，成就我从主耶稣所领受的职事，证明神恩惠的福音。
verses.en: However, I consider my life worth nothing to me; my only aim is to finish the race and complete the task the Lord Jesus has given me—the task of testifying to the good news of God's grace.

verses.zh: 我曾在你们众人中间来往，传讲神国的道，如今我晓得，你们以后都不得再见我的面了。
verses.en: Now I know that none of you among whom I have gone about preaching the kingdom will ever see me again.

verses.zh: 所以我今日向你们证明，你们中间无论何人死亡，罪不在我身上。
verses.en: Therefore, I declare to you today that I am innocent of the blood of any of you.

verses.zh: 因为神的旨意，我并没有一样避讳不传给你们的。
verses.en: For I have not hesitated to proclaim to you the whole will of God.

verses.zh: 圣灵立你们作全群的监督，你们就当为自己谨慎，也为全群谨慎，牧养神的教会，就是他用自己血所买来的。
verses.en: Keep watch over yourselves and all the flock of which the Holy Spirit has made you overseers. Be shepherds of the church of God, which he bought with his own blood.

verses.zh: 我知道我去之后，必有凶暴的豺狼进入你们中间，不爱惜羊群。
verses.en: I know that after I leave, savage wolves will come in among you and will not spare the flock.

verses.zh: 就是你们中间，也必有人起来，说悖谬的话，要引诱门徒跟从他们。
verses.en: Even from your own number men will arise and distort the truth in order to draw away disciples after them.

verses.zh: 所以你们应当警醒，记念我三年之久，昼夜不住地流泪，劝戒你们各人。
verses.en: So be on your guard! Remember that for three years I never stopped warning each of you night and day with tears.

verses.zh: 如今我把你们交托神和他恩惠的道。这道能建立你们，叫你们和一切成圣的人同得基业。
verses.en: Now I commit you to God and to the word of his grace, which can build you up and give you an inheritance among all those who are sanctified.

verses.zh: 我未曾贪图一个人的金、银、衣服。
verses.en: I have not coveted anyone's silver or gold or clothing.

verses.zh: 我这两只手，常供给我和同人的需用，这是你们自己知道的。
verses.en: You yourselves know that these hands of mine have supplied my own needs and the needs of my companions.

verses.zh: 我凡事给你们作榜样，叫你们知道，应当这样劳苦，扶助软弱的人，又当记念主耶稣的话，说：施比受更为有福。
verses.en: In everything I did, I showed you that by this kind of hard work we must help the weak, remembering the words the Lord Jesus himself said: It is more blessed to give than to receive.

verses.zh: 保罗说了这话，就跪下同众人祷告。
verses.en: When Paul had finished speaking, he knelt down with all of them and prayed.

verses.zh: 众人痛哭，抱着保罗的颈项，和他亲嘴。
verses.en: They all wept as they embraced him and kissed him.

verses.zh: 叫他们最伤心的，就是他说：以后不得再见我的面那句话。于是送他上船去了。
verses.en: What grieved them most was his statement that they would never see his face again. Then they accompanied him to the ship.

verses.zh: 我们离别了众人，就开船一直行到哥士。第二天到了罗底，从那里到帕大喇，
verses.en: After we had torn ourselves away from them, we put out to sea and sailed straight to Kos. The next day we went to Rhodes and from there to Patara.

verses.zh: 遇见一只船要往腓尼基去，就上船起行。
verses.en: We found a ship crossing over to Phoenicia, went on board and set sail.

verses.zh: 望见塞浦路斯，就从南边行过它，往叙利亚去，我们就在推罗上岸，因为船要在那里卸货。
verses.en: After sighting Cyprus and passing to the south of it, we sailed on to Syria. We landed at Tyre, where our ship was to unload its cargo.

verses.zh: 找着了门徒，就在那里住了七天。他们被圣灵感动，对保罗说：不要上耶路撒冷去。
verses.en: We sought out the disciples there and stayed with them seven days. Through the Spirit they urged Paul not to go on to Jerusalem.

verses.zh: 过了这几天，我们就起身前行。他们众人同妻子儿女，送我们到城外，我们都跪在岸上祷告，彼此辞别。
verses.en: When it was time to leave, we left and continued on our way. All of them, including wives and children, accompanied us out of the city, and there on the beach we knelt to pray.

verses.zh: 我们上了船，他们就回家去了。
verses.en: After saying goodbye to each other, we went aboard the ship, and they returned home.

verses.zh: 我们从推罗行尽了水路，来到多利买，就问那里的弟兄安，住了—天。
verses.en: We continued our voyage from Tyre and landed at Ptolemais, where we greeted the brothers and sisters and stayed with them for a day.

verses.zh: 第二天，我们离开那里，来到凯撒利亚，就进了传福音的腓利家里，和他同住。他是七个执事里的一个。
verses.en: Leaving the next day, we reached Caesarea and stayed at the house of Philip the evangelist, one of the Seven.

verses.zh: 他有四个女儿，都是处女，是说预言的。
verses.en: He had four unmarried daughters who prophesied.

verses.zh: 我们在那里多住了几天，有一个先知，名叫亚迦布，从犹太下来。
verses.en: After we had been there a number of days, a prophet named Agabus came down from Judea.

verses.zh: 到了我们这里，就拿保罗的腰带，捆上自己的手脚，说：圣灵说，犹太人在耶路撒冷，要如此捆绑这腰带的主人，把他交给外邦人手里。
verses.en: Coming over to us, he took Paul's belt, tied his own hands and feet with it and said, The Holy Spirit says, In this way the Jewish leaders in Jerusalem will bind the owner of this belt and will hand him over to the Gentiles.

verses.zh: 我们和那本地的人听见这话，都苦劝保罗不要上耶路撒冷去。
verses.en: When we heard this, we and the people there pleaded with Paul not to go up to Jerusalem.

verses.zh: 保罗说：你们为什么这样痛哭，使我心碎呢？我为主耶稣的名，不但被人捆绑，就是死在耶路撒冷，也是愿意的。
verses.en: Then Paul answered, Why are you weeping and breaking my heart? I am ready not only to be bound, but also to die in Jerusalem for the name of the Lord Jesus.

verses.zh: 他既劝不过来，我们便住了口，只说：愿主的旨意成就。于是我们就不说了。
verses.en: When he would not be dissuaded, we gave up and said, The Lord's will be done.

verses.zh: 过了几日，我们收拾行李上耶路撒冷去。
verses.en: After this, we started on our way up to Jerusalem.

verses.zh: 有凯撒利亚的几个门徒和我们同去，带我们到一个久为门徒的家里，叫我们与他同住。他名叫拿孙，是塞浦路斯人。
verses.en: Some of the disciples from Caesarea accompanied us and brought us to the home of Mnason, where we were to stay. He was a man from Cyprus and one of the early disciples.

verses.zh: 到了耶路撒冷，弟兄们欢欢喜喜地接待我们。
verses.en: When we arrived at Jerusalem, the brothers and sisters received us warmly.

verses.zh: 第二天，保罗同我们去见雅各，长老们也都在那里。
verses.en: The next day Paul and the rest of us went to see James, and all the elders were present.

verses.zh: 保罗问了他们安，便将神用他传教，在外邦人中间所行的事，一一述说。
verses.en: Paul greeted them and reported in detail what God had done among the Gentiles through his ministry.

verses.zh: 他们听见，就归荣耀与神，对保罗说：兄台，你看犹太人中信主的有多少万，都是热心守律法的。
verses.en: When they heard this, they praised God. Then they said to Paul: You see, brother, how many thousands of Jews have believed, and all of them are zealous for the law.

verses.zh: 他们听见人说，你教训一切在外邦的犹太人，离弃摩西，对他们说，不要给孩子行割礼，也不要遵行条规。
verses.en: They have been informed that you teach all the Jews who live among the Gentiles to turn away from Moses, telling them not to circumcise their children or live according to our customs.

verses.zh: 众人必听见你来了，这可怎么办呢？
verses.en: What shall we do? They will certainly hear that you have come,

verses.zh: 你就照着我们的话行吧！我们这里有四个人，都有愿在身。
verses.en: so do what we tell you. There are four men with us who have made a vow.

verses.zh: 你带他们去，与他们一同行洁净的礼，花销用在他们身上，叫他们剃头。这样，众人就可知道，先前听见的事都是虚的，乃可知你自己也遵行律法。
verses.en: Take these men, join in their purification rites and pay their expenses, so that they can have their heads shaved. Then everyone will know there is no truth in these reports about you, but that you yourself are living in obedience to the law.

verses.zh: 至于信主的外邦人，我们已经写信拟定，叫他们谨守的，无非是不可吃祭偶像之物和血，并勒死的牲畜，与奸淫。
verses.en: As for the Gentile believers, we have written to them our decision that they should abstain from food sacrificed to idols, from blood, from the meat of strangled animals and from sexual immorality.

verses.zh: 于是保罗带着那四个人，第二天与他们一同行了洁净的礼，进了殿，报明洁净的日期满足，只等祭司为他们各人献祭。
verses.en: The next day Paul took the men and purified himself along with them. Then he went to the temple to give notice of the date when the days of purification would end and the offering would be made for each of them.

verses.zh: 那七日将完，从亚西亚来的犹太人，看见他在殿里，就耸动众人，下手拿他，
verses.en: When the seven days were nearly over, some Jews from the province of Asia saw Paul at the temple. They stirred up the whole crowd and seized him,

verses.zh: 喊叫说：以色列人来帮助，这就是在各处教训众人糟践我们百姓和律法，并这地方的。他又带着希腊人进殿，污秽了这圣地。
verses.en: shouting, Fellow Israelites, help us! This is the man who teaches everyone everywhere against our people and our law and this place. And besides, he has brought Greeks into the temple and defiled this holy place.

verses.zh: 这话是因他们曾看见以弗所人特罗非摩同保罗在城里，以为保罗带他进了殿。
verses.en: They had previously seen Trophimus the Ephesian in the city with Paul and assumed that Paul had brought him into the temple.

verses.zh: 合城都震动，百姓一齐跑来，拿住保罗，拉他出殿，殿门立刻都关了。
verses.en: The whole city was aroused, and the people came running from all directions. Seizing Paul, they dragged him from the temple, and immediately the gates were shut.

verses.zh: 他们正想要杀他，有人报信给营里的千夫长说：耶路撒冷合城都乱了。
verses.en: While they were trying to kill him, news reached the commander of the Roman troops that the whole city of Jerusalem was in an uproar.

verses.zh: 千夫长立刻带着兵丁和几个百夫长，跑下去到他们那里。他们见了千夫长和兵丁，就止住不打保罗。
verses.en: He at once took some officers and soldiers and ran down to the crowd. When the rioters saw the commander and his soldiers, they stopped beating Paul.

verses.zh: 千夫长就上前拿住他，吩咐用两条铁链捆锁，又问众人是甚么人，作了甚么事。
verses.en: The commander came up and arrested him and ordered him to be bound with two chains. Then he asked who he was and what he had done.

verses.zh: 众人有喊叫这个的，有喊叫那个的。千夫长因为这样乱嚷，不能详细知道底细，就吩咐人将保罗带进营楼去。
verses.en: Some in the crowd shouted one thing and some another, and since the commander could not get at the truth because of the uproar, he ordered that Paul be taken into the barracks.

verses.zh: 到了台阶上，众人挤得凶猛，兵丁只得将保罗抬起来。
verses.en: When Paul reached the steps, the violence of the mob was so great he had to be carried by the soldiers.

verses.zh: 众人跟在后面，喊着说：除掉他。
verses.en: The crowd that followed kept shouting, Get rid of him!

verses.zh: 将要带他进营楼的时候，保罗对千夫长说：我对你说句话，可以不可以？他说：你懂得希腊话吗？
verses.en: As the soldiers were about to take Paul into the barracks, he asked the commander, May I say something to you? Do you speak Greek? he replied.

verses.zh: 你莫非是从前作乱，带领四千凶徒往旷野去的那埃及人吗？
verses.en: Aren't you the Egyptian who started a revolt and led four thousand terrorists out into the wilderness some time ago?

verses.zh: 保罗说：我本是犹太人，生在基利家的大数，并不是无名小城的人。求你准我对百姓说话。
verses.en: Paul answered, I am a Jew, from Tarsus in Cilicia, a citizen of no ordinary city. Please let me speak to the people.

verses.zh: 千夫长准了，保罗就站在台阶上，向百姓摆手。他们都静默无声，保罗便用希伯来话对他们说：
verses.en: After receiving the commander's permission, Paul stood on the steps and motioned to the people. When they were all silent, he said to them in Aramaic:

verses.zh: 诸位父兄请听，我现在对你们分诉。
verses.en: Brothers and fathers, listen now to my defense.

verses.zh: 众人听见他用希伯来话对他们说话，就更加安静了。
verses.en: When they heard him speak to them in Aramaic, they became very quiet.

verses.zh: 保罗说：我原是犹太人，生在基利家的大数，长在这城里，在迦玛列门下，按着我们祖宗严紧的律法受教，热心事奉神，像你们众人今日一样。
verses.en: I am a Jew, born in Tarsus of Cilicia, but brought up in this city. I studied under Gamaliel and was thoroughly trained in the law of our ancestors. I was just as zealous for God as any of you are today.

verses.zh: 我曾逼迫奉这道的人，直到死地，无论男女都锁拿下监。
verses.en: I persecuted the followers of this Way to their death, arresting both men and women and throwing them into prison,

verses.zh: 这是大祭司和众长老都可以给我作见证的。我又领了他们写给弟兄的书信，往大马士革去，要把在那里奉这道的人锁拿，带到耶路撒冷受刑。
verses.en: as the high priest and all the Council can themselves testify. I even obtained letters from them to their associates in Damascus, and went there to bring these people as prisoners to Jerusalem to be punished.

verses.zh: 我将到大马士革，正走的时候，约在晌午，忽然从天上发大光，四面照着我。
verses.en: About noon as I came near Damascus, suddenly a bright light from heaven flashed around me.

verses.zh: 我就仆倒在地，听见有声音对我说：扫罗，扫罗，你为什么逼迫我？
verses.en: I fell to the ground and heard a voice say to me, Saul! Saul! Why do you persecute me?

verses.zh: 我回答说：主啊，你是谁？他说：我就是你所逼迫的拿撒勒人耶稣。
verses.en: Who are you, Lord? I asked. I am Jesus of Nazareth, whom you are persecuting, he replied.

verses.zh: 与我同行的人看见了那光，却没有听明那位对我说话的声音。
verses.en: My companions saw the light, but they did not understand the voice of him who was speaking to me.

verses.zh: 我说：主啊，我当怎样行？主说：起来，进大马士革去，在那里要将所派你作的一切事告诉你。
verses.en: What shall I do, Lord? I asked. Get up, the Lord said, and go into Damascus. There you will be told all that you have been assigned to do.

verses.zh: 我因那光的荣耀，不能看见，同行的人就拉着我手进了大马士革。
verses.en: My companions led me by the hand into Damascus, because the brilliance of the light had blinded me.

verses.zh: 那里有一个人，名叫亚拿尼亚，按着律法是虔诚人，为一切住在那里的犹太人所称赞。
verses.en: A man named Ananias came to see me. He was a devout observer of the law and highly respected by all the Jews living there.

verses.zh: 他来见我，站在旁边，对我说：兄弟扫罗，你可以看见。我当时往上一看，就看见了他。
verses.en: He stood beside me and said, Brother Saul, receive your sight! And at that very moment I was able to see him.

verses.zh: 他又说：我们祖宗的神拣选了你，叫你明白他的旨意，又得见那义者，听他口中所出的声音。
verses.en: Then he said: The God of our ancestors has chosen you to know his will and to see the Righteous One and to hear words from his mouth.

verses.zh: 因为你要将所见所闻的，向万人作见证。
verses.en: You will be his witness to all people of what you have seen and heard.

verses.zh: 现在你为什么耽延呢？起来！求告他的名受洗，洗去你的罪。
verses.en: And now what are you waiting for? Get up, be baptized and wash your sins away, calling on his name.

verses.zh: 后来，我回到耶路撒冷，在殿里祷告的时候，魂游象外，
verses.en: When I returned to Jerusalem and was praying at the temple, I fell into a trance

verses.zh: 看见主向我说：你赶紧地离开耶路撒冷，不可迟延，因为你为我作的见证，他们必不领受。
verses.en: and saw the Lord speaking to me. Quick! he said. Leave Jerusalem immediately, because the people here will not accept your testimony about me.

verses.zh: 我就说：主啊，他们知道我从前把信你的人收在监里，又在各会堂里鞭打他们。
verses.en: Lord, I replied, these people know that I went from one synagogue to another to imprison and beat those who believe in you.

verses.zh: 并且你的见证人司提反被害流血的时候，我也站在旁边欢喜，又看守害死他之人的衣裳。
verses.en: And when the blood of your martyr Stephen was shed, I stood there giving my approval and guarding the clothes of those who were killing him.

verses.zh: 主向我说：你去吧！我也要差你往外邦人那里去。
verses.en: Then the Lord said to me, Go; I will send you far away to the Gentiles.

verses.zh: 众人听他说到这句话，就高声喊叫说：这样的人，从世上除掉他吧！他是不当活着的。
verses.en: The crowd listened to Paul until he said this. Then they raised their voices and shouted, Rid the earth of him! He's not fit to live!

verses.zh: 众人喧嚷，摔掉衣裳，把尘土向空中扬起来。
verses.en: As they were shouting and throwing off their cloaks and flinging dust into the air,

verses.zh: 千夫长就吩咐将保罗带进营楼去，叫人用鞭子拷问他，要知道他们向他这样喧嚷是为什么缘故。
verses.en: the commander ordered that Paul be taken into the barracks. He directed that he be flogged and interrogated in order to find out why the people were shouting at him like this.

verses.zh: 刚用皮条捆上，保罗对旁边站着的百夫长说：人是罗马人，又没有定罪，你们就鞭打他，有这个例吗？
verses.en: As they stretched him out to flog him, Paul said to the centurion standing there, Is it legal for you to flog a Roman citizen who hasn't even been found guilty?

verses.zh: 百夫长听见这话，就去见千夫长，告诉他说：你要作什么？这人是罗马人。
verses.en: When the centurion heard this, he went to the commander and reported it. What are you going to do? he asked. This man is a Roman citizen.

verses.zh: 千夫长就来问保罗说：你告诉我，你是罗马人吗？保罗说：是。
verses.en: The commander went to Paul and asked, Tell me, are you a Roman citizen? Yes, he answered.

verses.zh: 千夫长说：我用许多银子，才入了罗马的民籍。保罗说：我生来就是。
verses.en: Then the commander said, I had to pay a lot of money for my citizenship. But I was born a citizen, Paul replied.

verses.zh: 于是那些要拷问他的人，就离开他去了。千夫长既知道他是罗马人，又因为捆绑了他，也害怕了。
verses.en: Those who were about to interrogate him withdrew immediately. The commander himself was alarmed when he realized that he had put Paul, a Roman citizen, in chains.

verses.zh: 第二天，千夫长为要知道犹太人控告他的实情，便解开他，吩咐祭司长和全公会的人都聚集，将保罗带下来，叫他站在他们面前。
verses.en: The next day, since the commander wanted to find out exactly why Paul was being accused by the Jews, he released him and ordered the chief priests and all the members of the Sanhedrin to assemble. Then he brought Paul and had him stand before them.

verses.zh: 保罗定睛看着公会的人，说：诸位弟兄，我在神面前行事为人，都是凭着良心，直到今日。
verses.en: Paul looked straight at the Sanhedrin and said, My brothers, I have fulfilled my duty to God in all good conscience to this day.

verses.zh: 大祭司亚拿尼亚，就吩咐旁边站着的人打他的嘴。
verses.en: At this the high priest Ananias ordered those standing near Paul to strike him on the mouth.

verses.zh: 保罗对他说：你这粉饰的墙，神要打你！你坐堂为的是按律法审问我，你竟违背律法，打我吗？
verses.en: Then Paul said to him, God will strike you, you whitewashed wall! You sit there to judge me according to the law, yet you yourself violate the law by commanding that I be struck!

verses.zh: 旁边站着的人说：你辱骂神的大祭司吗？
verses.en: Those who were standing near Paul said, How dare you insult God's high priest!

verses.zh: 保罗说：弟兄们，我不知道他是大祭司。经上记着说：不可毁谤你百姓的官长。
verses.en: Paul replied, Brothers, I did not realize that he was the high priest; for it is written: Do not speak evil about the ruler of your people.

verses.zh: 保罗看出大众一半是撒都该人，一半是法利赛人，就在公会中大声说：弟兄们，我是法利赛人，也是法利赛人的子孙。我现在受审问，是为盼望死人复活。
verses.en: Then Paul, knowing that some of them were Sadducees and the others Pharisees, called out in the Sanhedrin, My brothers, I am a Pharisee, descended from Pharisees. I stand on trial because of the hope of the resurrection of the dead.

verses.zh: 说了这话，法利赛人和撒都该人就争论起来，会众分为两党。
verses.en: When he said this, a dispute broke out between the Pharisees and the Sadducees, and the assembly was divided.

verses.zh: 因为撒都该人说，没有复活，也没有天使和鬼魂；法利赛人却说，两样都有。
verses.en: The Sadducees say that there is no resurrection, and that there are neither angels nor spirits, but the Pharisees believe both.

verses.zh: 于是大大地喧嚷起来。有几个法利赛党的文士站起来，争辩说：我们看不出这人有甚么恶处，若是有鬼魂，或是天使对他说过话，那便罢了吧。
verses.en: There was a great uproar, and some of the teachers of the law who were Pharisees stood up and argued vigorously. We find nothing wrong with this man, they said. What if a spirit or an angel has spoken to him?

verses.zh: 喧嚷越发大了，千夫长恐怕保罗被他们扯碎了，就吩咐兵丁下去，把他从众人当中抢出来，带进营楼去。
verses.en: The dispute became so violent that the commander was afraid Paul would be torn to pieces by them. He ordered the troops to go down and take him away from them by force and bring him into the barracks.

verses.zh: 当夜，主站在保罗旁边，说：放心吧！你怎样在耶路撒冷为我作见证，也必怎样在罗马为我作见证。
verses.en: The following night the Lord stood near Paul and said, Take courage! As you have testified about me in Jerusalem, so you must also testify in Rome.

verses.zh: 到了天亮，犹太人同谋起誓，说：若不先杀保罗，就不吃不喝。
verses.en: The next morning some Jews formed a conspiracy and bound themselves with an oath not to eat or drink until they had killed Paul.

verses.zh: 这样同心起誓的有四十多人。
verses.en: More than forty men were involved in this plot.

verses.zh: 他们来见祭司长和长老，说：我们已经起誓，若不先杀保罗，就不吃甚么。
verses.en: They went to the chief priests and the elders and said, We have taken a solemn oath not to eat anything until we have killed Paul.

verses.zh: 现在你们和公会要知会千夫长，叫他带下保罗到你们这里来，假作要详细察考他的事。我们已经预备好了，等他来到，一面就杀他。
verses.en: Now then, you and the Sanhedrin petition the commander to bring Paul before you on the pretext of wanting more accurate information about his case. We are ready to kill him before he gets here.

verses.zh: 保罗的外甥听见他们设下埋伏，就来到营楼里告诉保罗。
verses.en: But when the son of Paul's sister heard of this plot, he went into the barracks and told Paul about it.

verses.zh: 保罗请一个百夫长来，说：你领这少年人去见千夫长，他有事告诉他。
verses.en: Then Paul called one of the centurions and said, Take this young man to the commander; he has something to tell him.

verses.zh: 于是把他领去见千夫长，说：被囚的保罗请我到他那里，求我领这少年人来见你，他有话告诉你。
verses.en: So he took him to the commander. The centurion said, Paul, the prisoner, sent for me and asked me to bring this young man to you because he has something to tell you.

verses.zh: 千夫长拉着他的手，退到一旁，私下问他说：你有什么事告诉我呢？
verses.en: The commander took the young man by the hand, drew him aside and asked, What is it you want to tell me?

verses.zh: 他说：犹太人已经约定，要求你明天带保罗下到公会里去，假作要详细察考他的事。
verses.en: He said: Some Jews have agreed to ask you to bring Paul before the Sanhedrin tomorrow on the pretext of wanting more accurate information about him.

verses.zh: 你切不要听从他们，因为他们有四十多人埋伏，已经起誓，若不先杀保罗，就不吃不喝。现在预备好了，只等你应允。
verses.en: Don't give in to them, because more than forty of them are waiting in ambush for him. They have taken an oath not to eat or drink until they have killed him. They are ready now, waiting for your consent to their request.

verses.zh: 千夫长就打发少年人走，嘱咐他说：不要告诉人你将这事报给我了。
verses.en: The commander dismissed the young man with this warning: Don't tell anyone that you have reported this to me.

verses.zh: 千夫长便叫了两个百夫长来，说：预备步兵二百，马兵七十，长枪手二百，今夜亥初，从凯撒利亚押保罗往腓力斯方伯那里去。
verses.en: Then he called two of his centurions and ordered them, Get ready a detachment of two hundred soldiers, seventy horsemen and two hundred spearmen to go to Caesarea at nine tonight.

verses.zh: 也要预备牲口，叫保罗骑上，护送到腓力斯方伯那里。
verses.en: Provide horses for Paul so that he may be taken safely to Governor Felix.

verses.zh: 千夫长又写了文书，
verses.en: He wrote a letter as follows:

verses.zh: 大意说：革老丢吕西亚，致问最尊贵的方伯腓力斯。
verses.en: Claudius Lysias, To His Excellency, Governor Felix: Greetings.

verses.zh: 这人被犹太人拿住，将要杀他，我得知他是罗马人，就带兵丁下去救他出来。
verses.en: This man was seized by the Jews and they were about to kill him, but I came with my troops and rescued him, for I had learned that he is a Roman citizen.

verses.zh: 我要知道他们告他的缘故，就带他下到他们的公会去，
verses.en: I wanted to know why they were accusing him, so I brought him to their Sanhedrin.

verses.zh: 便查知他被告的缘故，是因他们律法上的辩论，并没有甚么该死该绑的罪名。
verses.en: I found that the accusation had to do with questions about their law, but there was no charge against him that deserved death or imprisonment.

verses.zh: 后来有人把要害他的计谋告诉我，我就立时解他到你那里去，又吩咐告他的人，到你面前告他。（愿你平安）
verses.en: When I was informed of a plot to be carried out against the man, I sent him to you at once. I also ordered his accusers to present to you their case against him.

verses.zh: 于是兵丁照所吩咐的，将保罗夜里带到安提帕底。
verses.en: So the soldiers, carrying out their orders, took Paul with them during the night and brought him as far as Antipatris.

verses.zh: 第二天，让马兵同他去，把他交与千夫长，就回营楼去了。
verses.en: The next day they let the cavalry go on with him, while they returned to the barracks.

verses.zh: 马兵来到凯撒利亚，把文书呈给方伯，也把保罗解到他面前。
verses.en: On arriving in Caesarea, the cavalry handed Paul and the letter over to Governor Felix, and Felix read it.

verses.zh: 方伯念了，就问保罗是哪省的人，既晓得他是基利家人，
verses.en: After reading it, he asked what province Paul was from. Learning that he was from Cilicia,

verses.zh: 就说：等告你的人来到，我要细听你的事。便吩咐人把他看守在希律的衙门里。
verses.en: he said, I will hear your case when your accusers get here. Then he ordered that Paul be kept under guard in Herod's palace.

verses.zh: 过了五天，大祭司亚拿尼亚，同几个长老，和一个辩士帖土罗，一起来到，向方伯控告保罗。
verses.en: Five days later the high priest Ananias went down to Caesarea with some of the elders and a lawyer named Tertullus, and they brought their charges against Paul before the governor.

verses.zh: 保罗被传了来，帖土罗就开口控告他说：
verses.en: When Paul was called in, Tertullus presented his case before Felix: We have enjoyed a long period of peace under you, and your foresight has brought about reforms in this nation.

verses.zh: 腓力斯大人，我们因你得以大享太平，并且这国藉着你的先见，得以更正一切事理，我们随时随地满心感谢不尽。
verses.en: Indeed, so true is this, that we acknowledge it everywhere and in every way with profound gratitude.

verses.zh: 但恐怕多说，你嫌烦絮，只求你宽容听我们说几句。
verses.en: But in order not to weary you further, I would request that you be kind enough to hear us briefly.

verses.zh: 我们看这人，如同瘟疫一般，是鼓动普天下犹太人作乱的，又是拿撒勒教党里的一个头目。
verses.en: We have found this man to be a troublemaker, stirring up riots among the Jews all over the world. He is a ringleader of the Nazarene sect

verses.zh: 连圣殿他也想要污秽，我们把他捉住了。（要按我们的律法审问他。）
verses.en: and even tried to desecrate the temple; so we seized him.

verses.zh: 不料，千夫长吕西亚前来，大力把他从我们手里夺去，吩咐告他的人到你这里来。
verses.en: By examining him yourself you will be able to learn the truth about all these charges we are bringing against him.

verses.zh: 你自己究问他，就可以知道我们告他的一切事，都是真的。
verses.en: The Jews joined in the accusation, asserting that these things were true.

verses.zh: 犹太人也随着告他说：事情果然是这样。
verses.en: Then Paul made his defense: I know that for a number of years you have been a judge over this nation; so I gladly make my defense.

verses.zh: 方伯点头，保罗就开口分诉说：我知道你在这国里断事多年，所以我乐意为自己分诉。
verses.en: You can easily verify that no more than twelve days ago I went up to Jerusalem to worship.

verses.zh: 你查问就可以知道，从我上耶路撒冷礼拜，到今日，不过有十二天。
verses.en: My accusers did not find me arguing with anyone at the temple, or stirring up a crowd in the synagogues or anywhere else in the city.

verses.zh: 他们并没有看见我在殿里，或是在会堂里，或是在城里，与人辩论，耸动众人。
verses.en: And they cannot prove to you the charges they are now making against me.

verses.zh: 他们现在所告我的事，连证据也不能给你。
verses.en: However, I admit that I worship the God of our ancestors as a follower of the Way, which they call a sect. I believe everything that is in accordance with the Law and that is written in the Prophets,

verses.zh: 然而有一件事，我向你承认，就是他们所称为异端的道，我正按着那道事奉我祖宗的神，又相信律法和先知一切所写的。
verses.en: and I have the same hope in God as these men themselves have, that there will be a resurrection of both the righteous and the wicked.

verses.zh: 并且靠着神，盼望死人，无论善恶，都要复活，就是他们自己也有这个盼望。
verses.en: So I strive always to keep my conscience clear before God and man.

verses.zh: 我因此自己勉励，对神、对人，常存无亏的良心。
verses.en: So I strive always to keep my conscience clear before God and man.

verses.zh: 过了几年，我带着赒济的礼物和供物上耶路撒冷来。
verses.en: After an absence of several years, I came to Jerusalem to bring my people gifts for the poor and to present offerings.

verses.zh: 那时，有几个亚西亚的犹太人看见我在殿里洁净了，他们并没有带甚么人，也没有吵嚷。
verses.en: But there are some Jews from the province of Asia, who ought to be here before you and bring charges if they have anything against me.

verses.zh: 惟有这几个人，若有告我的事，就应当到你面前来告我。
verses.en: Or these who are here should state what crime they found in me when I stood before the Sanhedrin—

verses.zh: 或者，让这些人在这里说，他们见我在公会站着的时候，有甚么不合理的地方没有。
verses.en: unless it was this one thing I shouted as I stood in their presence: It is concerning the resurrection of the dead that I am on trial before you today.

verses.zh: 纵然有，也不外乎一句话，就是我站在他们中间大声说：我今日在你们面前受审，是为死人复活的道理。
verses.en: Then Felix, who was well acquainted with the Way, adjourned the proceedings. When I get a chance, he said, I will summon you.

verses.zh: 腓力斯本是详细晓得这道，就支吾他们说：且等千夫长吕西亚下来，我要审断你们的事。
verses.en: He ordered the centurion to keep Paul under guard but to give him some freedom and permit his friends to take care of his needs.

verses.zh: 于是吩咐百夫长看守保罗，并且宽待他，也不拦阻他的亲友来供给他。
verses.en: Several days later Felix came with his wife Drusilla, who was Jewish. He sent for Paul and listened to him as he spoke about faith in Christ Jesus.

verses.zh: 过了几天，腓力斯和他夫人犹太的女子土西拉一同来到，就叫了保罗来，听他讲论信耶稣基督的道。
verses.en: As Paul talked about righteousness, self-control and the judgment to come, Felix was afraid and said, That's enough for now! You may leave. When I find it convenient, I will send for you.

verses.zh: 保罗讲论公义、节制，和将来的审判，腓力斯甚觉恐惧，说：你暂且去吧，等我得便再叫你来。
verses.en: At the same time he was hoping that Paul would offer him a bribe, so he sent for him frequently and talked with him.

verses.zh: 腓力斯又指望保罗送他银钱，所以屡次叫他来，和他谈论。
verses.en: When two years had passed, Felix was succeeded by Porcius Festus, but because Felix wanted to grant a favor to the Jews, he left Paul in prison.

verses.zh: 过了两年，波求非斯都接了腓力斯的任。腓力斯要讨犹太人的喜欢，就留保罗在监里。
verses.en: Three days later he called together the prominent Jewish leaders. When they had assembled, he presented Paul to them and said, Here is the man who was seized by the Jews and I had difficulty finding out from them whether he was guilty of anything worthy of death.

verses.zh: 非斯都到了任，过了三天，就从凯撒利亚上耶路撒冷去。
verses.en: Three days after arriving in the province, Festus went up from Caesarea to Jerusalem,

verses.zh: 祭司长和犹太人的首领，向他控告保罗，
verses.en: where the chief priests and the Jewish leaders appeared before him and presented the charges against Paul.

verses.zh: 又央告他，求他的情，将保罗提到耶路撒冷来，他们要在路上埋伏杀害他。
verses.en: They requested Festus as a favor to them to have Paul transferred to Jerusalem, for they were preparing an ambush to kill him along the way.

verses.zh: 非斯都却回答说：保罗押在凯撒利亚，我自己快要往那里去。
verses.en: Festus answered, Paul is being held at Caesarea, and I myself am going there soon.

verses.zh: 又说：你们中间有权势的人，可以同我下去，告他有甚么不是，就可以告他。
verses.en: Let some of your leaders come with me, and if the man has done anything wrong, they can press charges against him there.

verses.zh: 非斯都在他们那里住了不过十天八天，就下凯撒利亚去。第二天坐堂，吩咐将保罗提上来。
verses.en: After spending eight or ten days with them, Festus went down to Caesarea. The next day he convened the court and ordered that Paul be brought before him.

verses.zh: 保罗来了，那些从耶路撒冷下来的犹太人，周围站着，告他许多重大的事，都是不能证实的。
verses.en: When Paul came in, the Jews who had come down from Jerusalem stood around him, bringing many serious charges against him, which they could not prove.

verses.zh: 保罗分诉说：无论犹太人的律法，或是圣殿，或是凯撒，我都没有得罪甚么。
verses.en: Then Paul made his defense: I have done nothing wrong against the Jewish law or against the temple or against Caesar.

verses.zh: 但非斯都要讨犹太人的喜欢，就问保罗说：你愿意上耶路撒冷去，在那里听我审断这事吗？
verses.en: Festus, wishing to do the Jews a favor, said to Paul, Are you willing to go up to Jerusalem and stand trial there on these charges before me?

verses.zh: 保罗说：我站在凯撒的堂前，这就是我应当受审的地方。我向犹太人并没有行过甚么不义的事，这也是你明明知道的。
verses.en: Paul answered: I am now standing before Caesar's court, where I ought to be tried. I have not done any wrong to the Jews, as you yourself know very well.

verses.zh: 我若行了不义的事，犯了甚么该死的罪，就是死，我也不辞。他们所告我的事若都不实，就没有人可以把我交给他们。我要上告于凯撒。
verses.en: If, however, I am guilty of doing anything deserving death, I do not refuse to die. But if the charges brought against me by these Jews are not true, no one has the right to hand me over to them. I appeal to Caesar!

verses.zh: 非斯都和议会商量了，就说：你既上告于凯撒，可以往凯撒那里去。
verses.en: After Festus had conferred with his council, he declared: You have appealed to Caesar. To Caesar you will go!

verses.zh: 过了些日子，亚基帕王和百妮基氏来到凯撒利亚，问非斯都安。
verses.en: A few days later King Agrippa and Bernice arrived at Caesarea to pay their respects to Festus.

verses.zh: 在那里住了多日，非斯都将保罗的事告诉王，说：有一个囚犯，腓力斯留在监里。
verses.en: Since they were spending many days there, Festus discussed Paul's case with the king. He said: There is a man here whom Felix left as a prisoner.

verses.zh: 我在耶路撒冷的时候，祭司长和犹太长老，将他的事禀报了我，求我定他的罪。
verses.en: When I went to Jerusalem, the chief priests and the Jewish elders brought me information about him and asked me to pronounce sentence on him.

verses.zh: 我对他们说：无论是被告没有和原告当面辩驳，未得辩诉的机会，先定罪的例，罗马人没有。
verses.en: I told them that it is not the Roman custom to hand over anyone before they have faced their accusers and have had an opportunity to defend themselves against the charges.

verses.zh: 他们来到这里，我也不耽延，第二天便坐堂，叫人把他提上来。
verses.en: When they came here with me, I did not delay the matter, but convened the court the next day and ordered the man to be brought in.

verses.zh: 告他的人站着告他，所告的并没有我所逆料的恶事。
verses.en: When his accusers got up to speak, they did not charge him with any of the crimes I had expected.

verses.zh: 不过是与他辩论些关于他们敬鬼神和一个名叫耶稣、已经死了的人，保罗却说他是活的。
verses.en: Instead, they had some points of dispute with him about their own religion and about a dead man named Jesus who Paul claimed was alive.

verses.zh: 这些事当怎样究问，我心里作难，所以问他说：你愿意上耶路撒冷去，在那里为这些事听审吗？
verses.en: I was at a loss how to investigate such matters; so I asked if he would be willing to go to Jerusalem and stand trial there on these charges.

verses.zh: 亚基帕对非斯都说：我自己也愿听这人辩论。非斯都说：明天你可以听。
verses.en: Then Agrippa said to Festus, I would like to hear this man myself. Tomorrow you will hear him.

verses.zh: 第二天，亚基帕和百妮基大张威仪而来，同着千夫长和城里的尊贵人，进了公厅。非斯都吩咐一声，就有人将保罗带进来。
verses.en: The next day Agrippa and Bernice came with great pomp and entered the audience room with the high-ranking military officers and the prominent men of the city. At the command of Festus, Paul was brought in.

verses.zh: 非斯都说：亚基帕王和在这里的诸位啊，你们看这人，就是一切犹太人，在耶路撒冷和这里，曾向我恳求，喊叫说：他不该再活着。
verses.en: Festus said: King Agrippa, and all who are present with us, you see this man! The whole Jewish community has petitioned me about him in Jerusalem and here in Caesarea, shouting that he ought not to live any longer.

verses.zh: 但我查明他没有犯甚么该死的罪，并且他自己上告于皇帝，所以我定意把他解去。
verses.en: I found he had done nothing deserving of death, but because he made his appeal to the Emperor I decided to send him to Rome.

verses.zh: 论到这人，我没有确实的事可以奏明主上，所以带他到你们面前，也特意带到你亚基帕王面前，为要在查问之后，有所陈奏。
verses.en: But I have nothing definite to write to His Majesty about him. Therefore I have brought him before all of you, and especially before you, King Agrippa, so that as a result of this investigation I may have something to write.

verses.zh: 据我看来，解送囚犯，不表明他的罪案，是不合理的。
verses.en: For I think it is unreasonable to send a prisoner on to Rome without specifying the charges against him.

verses.zh: 亚基帕对保罗说：准你为自己辩明。于是保罗伸手分诉说：
verses.en: Then Agrippa said to Paul, You have permission to speak for yourself. So Paul motioned with his hand and began his defense:

verses.zh: 亚基帕王啊，犹太人所告我的一切事，今日得在你面前分诉，实为万幸。
verses.en: King Agrippa, I consider myself fortunate to stand before you today as I make my defense against all the accusations of the Jews,

verses.zh: 尤其因你熟悉犹太人的规矩和他们的辩论，所以求你耐心听我。
