verses.en: and especially so because you are well acquainted with all the Jewish customs and controversies. Therefore, I beg you to listen to me patiently.

verses.zh: 我从起初在本国的民中，并在耶路撒冷，自幼为人如何，犹太人都知道。
verses.en: The Jewish people all know the way I have lived ever since I was a child, from the beginning of my life in my own country, and also in Jerusalem.

verses.zh: 他们若肯作见证，就晓得我从起初是按着我们教中最严紧的教门作了法利赛人。
verses.en: They have known me for a long time and can testify, if they are willing, that I conformed to the strictest sect of our religion, living as a Pharisee.

verses.zh: 现在我站在这里受审，是因为指望神向我们祖宗所应许的。
verses.en: And now it is because of my hope in what God has promised our ancestors that I am on trial today.

verses.zh: 这应许，我们十二个支派，昼夜切切地事奉神，都指望得着。王啊，我被犹太人控告，就是因这指望。
verses.en: This is the promise our twelve tribes are hoping to see fulfilled as they earnestly serve God day and night. King Agrippa, it is because of this hope that these Jews are accusing me.

verses.zh: 神既叫死人复活，你们为什么看作不可信的呢？
verses.en: Why should any of you consider it incredible that God raises the dead?

verses.zh: 从前我自己以为应当多方攻击拿撒勒人耶稣的名。
verses.en: I too was convinced that I ought to do all that was possible to oppose the name of Jesus of Nazareth.

verses.zh: 我在耶路撒冷也曾这样行了。既从祭司长得了权柄，我就把许多圣徒囚在监里。他们被杀的时候，我也出名定案。
verses.en: And that is just what I did in Jerusalem. On the authority of the chief priests I put many of the Lord's people in prison, and when they were put to death, I cast my vote against them.

verses.zh: 在各会堂，我屡次用刑强逼他们说亵渎的话，又分外恼恨他们，甚至追逼他们直到外邦的城邑。
verses.en: Many a time I went from one synagogue to another to have them punished, and I tried to force them to blaspheme. I was so obsessed with persecuting them that I even hunted them down in foreign cities.

verses.zh: 那时，我领了祭司长的权柄和命令，往大马士革去。
verses.en: On one of these journeys I was going to Damascus with the authority and commission of the chief priests.

verses.zh: 王啊，在路上正午的时候，我看见从天上发光，比日头还亮，四面照着我，并与我同行的人。
verses.en: About noon, King Agrippa, as I was on the road, I saw a light from heaven, brighter than the sun, blazing around me and my companions.

verses.zh: 我们都仆倒在地，我就听见有声音，用希伯来话对我说：扫罗，扫罗，你为什么逼迫我？你用脚踢刺是难的。
verses.en: We all fell to the ground, and I heard a voice saying to me in Aramaic, Saul, Saul, why do you persecute me? It is hard for you to kick against the goads.

verses.zh: 我说：主啊，你是谁？主说：我就是你所逼迫的耶稣。
verses.en: Then I asked, Who are you, Lord? I am Jesus, whom you are persecuting, the Lord replied.

verses.zh: 你起来站着，我特意向你显现，要派你作执事作见证，将你所看见的事，和我将要指示你的事，证明出来。
verses.en: Now get up and stand on your feet. I have appeared to you to appoint you as a servant and as a witness of what you have seen and will see of me.

verses.zh: 我也要从百姓和外邦人中，救拔你出来，差你到他们那里去，
verses.en: I will rescue you from your own people and from the Gentiles. I am sending you to them

verses.zh: 我差你到他们那里去，要叫他们的眼睛得开，从黑暗中归向光明，从撒但权下归向神；又因信我，得蒙赦罪，和一切成圣的人同得基业。
verses.en: to open their eyes and turn them from darkness to light, and from the power of Satan to God, so that they may receive forgiveness of sins and a place among those who are sanctified by faith in me.

verses.zh: 亚基帕王啊，我故此没有违背那从天上来的异象。
verses.en: So then, King Agrippa, I was not disobedient to the vision from heaven.

verses.zh: 先在大马士革，后在耶路撒冷和犹太全地，以及外邦人，我都传明他们当悔改归向神，行事与悔改的心相称。
verses.en: First to those in Damascus, then to those in Jerusalem and in all Judea, and then to the Gentiles, I preached that they should repent and turn to God and demonstrate their repentance by their deeds.

verses.zh: 因此，犹太人在殿里拿住我，想要杀我。
verses.en: That is why some Jews seized me in the temple courts and tried to kill me.

verses.zh: 然而我蒙神的帮助，直到今日还站得住，对着尊贵卑贱老幼作见证，所讲的并不外乎众先知和摩西所说将来必成的事，
verses.en: But God has helped me to this very day; so I stand here and testify to small and great alike. I am saying nothing beyond what the prophets and Moses said would happen—

verses.zh: 就是基督必受害，又是首先从死里复活，将光明的道传给百姓和外邦人。
verses.en: that the Messiah would suffer and, as the first to rise from the dead, would bring the message of light to his own people and to the Gentiles.

verses.zh: 保罗这样分诉，非斯都大声说：保罗，你癫狂了吧！你的学问太大，反叫你癫狂了。
verses.en: At this point Festus interrupted Paul's defense. You are out of your mind, Paul! he shouted. Your great learning is driving you insane.

verses.zh: 保罗说：非斯都大人，我不是癫狂，我说的乃是真实明白的话。
verses.en: I am not insane, most excellent Festus, Paul replied. What I am saying is true and reasonable.

verses.zh: 王也晓得这些事，所以我向王放胆直言，我一点不信这些事是隐藏的，因为这不是在偏僻地方行的事。
verses.en: The king is familiar with these things, and I can speak freely to him. I am convinced that none of this has escaped his notice, because it was not done in a corner.

verses.zh: 亚基帕王啊，你信先知吗？我知道你是信的。
verses.en: King Agrippa, do you believe the prophets? I know you do.

verses.zh: 亚基帕对保罗说：你想少微一劝，便叫我作基督徒了。
verses.en: Then Agrippa said to Paul, Do you think that in such a short time you can persuade me to be a Christian?

verses.zh: 保罗说：无论是少微或多多，我向神所求，不但你一个人，就是今天一切听我的，都要像我一样，只是不要像我有这些锁链。
verses.en: Paul replied, Short time or long—I pray to God that not only you but all who are listening to me today may become what I am, except for these chains.

verses.zh: 于是王和方伯并百妮基，与同坐的人都起来，
verses.en: The king rose, and with him the governor and Bernice and those sitting with them.

verses.zh: 退到旁边商议，说：这人并没有犯甚么该死该绑的罪。
verses.en: After they left the room, they began saying to one another, This man is not doing anything that deserves death or imprisonment.

verses.zh: 亚基帕对非斯都说：这人若没有上告于凯撒，就可以释放他了。
verses.en: Agrippa said to Festus, This man could have been set free if he had not appealed to Caesar.

verses.zh: 非斯都既然定规了，叫我们坐船往意大利去，就将保罗和别的囚犯交给御营里的一个百夫长，名叫犹流。
verses.en: When it was decided that we would sail for Italy, Paul and some other prisoners were handed over to a centurion named Julius, who belonged to the Imperial Regiment.

verses.zh: 有一只亚大米田的船，要往亚西亚沿岸地方去，我们就上了那船开行，有马其顿的帖撒罗尼迦人亚里达古和我们同去。
verses.en: We boarded a ship from Adramyttium about to sail for ports along the coast of the province of Asia, and we put out to sea. Aristarchus, a Macedonian from Thessalonica, was with us.

verses.zh: 第二天，到了西顿。犹流宽待保罗，准他往朋友那里去，受他们的照应。
verses.en: The next day we landed at Sidon; and Julius, in kindness to Paul, allowed him to go to his friends so they might provide for his needs.

verses.zh: 从那里又开船，因为风不顺，就贴着塞浦路斯背风岸行去。
verses.en: From there we put out to sea again and passed to the lee of Cyprus because the winds were against us.

verses.zh: 过了基利家、旁非利亚的海，就到了吕家的每拉。
verses.en: When we had sailed across the open sea off the coast of Cilicia and Pamphylia, we landed at Myra in Lycia.

verses.zh: 在那里，百夫长遇见一只亚力山太的船，要往意大利去，便叫我们上了那船。
verses.en: There the centurion found an Alexandrian ship sailing for Italy and put us on board.

verses.zh: 一连多日，船行得慢，仅仅来到革尼土的对面。因为风不顺，不能够再往前去，就贴着克里特背风岸，从撒摩尼对面行过。
verses.en: We made slow headway for many days and had difficulty arriving off Cnidus. When the wind did not allow us to hold our course, we sailed to the lee of Crete, opposite Salmone.

verses.zh: 贴着海岸勉强行过，就来到一个地方，名叫佳澳，是吕家和拉西亚两城的港口。
verses.en: We moved along the coast with difficulty and came to a place called Fair Havens, near the town of Lasea.

verses.zh: 过了多日，危险的日子已经过去，过逾越节也不宜了。保罗就劝众人说：
verses.en: Much time had been lost, and sailing had already become dangerous because by now it was after the Day of Atonement. So Paul warned them,

verses.zh: 诸位，我看这次行船，不但货物和船要受伤损，大遭破坏，连我们的性命也难保。
verses.en: Men, I can see that our voyage is going to be disastrous and bring great loss to ship and cargo, and to our own lives also.

verses.zh: 但百夫长信从掌船的和船主，不信从保罗所说的话。
verses.en: But the centurion, instead of listening to what Paul said, followed the advice of the pilot and of the owner of the ship.

verses.zh: 且因这海口不宜冬天住，船上的人多半说，不如开船离开这地方，或者能到非尼基过冬。非尼基是克里特的一个海口，一面朝东北，一面朝东南。
verses.en: Since the harbor was unsuitable to winter in, the majority decided that we should sail on, hoping to reach Phoenix and winter there. This was a harbor in Crete, facing both southwest and northwest.

verses.zh: 这时，微微起了南风，他们以为得意，就起了锚，贴近克里特行去。
verses.en: When a gentle south wind began to blow, they saw their opportunity; so they weighed anchor and sailed along the shore of Crete.

verses.zh: 不多几时，狂风从岛上扑下来，那风名叫友拉革罗。
verses.en: Before very long, a wind of hurricane force, called the Northeaster, swept down from the island.

verses.zh: 船被风抓住，敌不住风，我们就任风刮去。
verses.en: The ship was caught by the storm and could not head into the wind; so we gave way to it and were driven along.

verses.zh: 我们被一个叫高大的小岛遮蔽，就勉强收住了小船。
verses.en: As we passed to the lee of a small island called Cauda, we were hardly able to make the lifeboat secure,

verses.zh: 把它拉上来，用缆索捆绑船底，又恐怕在赛耳底沙滩上搁浅，就落下篷来，任船飘去。
verses.en: so the men hoisted it aboard. Then they passed ropes under the ship itself to hold it together. Because they were afraid of being driven aground on the sandbars of Syrtis, they lowered the sea anchor and let the ship be driven along.

verses.zh: 我们被风浪逼得甚急，第二天众人就把货物抛在海里。
verses.en: We took such a violent battering from the storm that the next day they began to throw the cargo overboard.

verses.zh: 到第三天，他们又亲手把船上的器具抛弃了。
verses.en: On the third day, they threw the ship's tackle overboard with their own hands.

verses.zh: 太阳和星辰多日不显露，又有狂风大浪催逼，我们得救的指望就都绝了。
verses.en: When neither sun nor stars appeared for many days and the storm continued raging, we finally gave up all hope of being saved.

verses.zh: 众人多日没有吃甚么，保罗就站在他们中间，说：诸位，你们本该听我的话，不离开克里特，免得遭这样的伤损破坏。
verses.en: After they had gone a long time without food, Paul stood up before them and said: Men, you should have taken my advice not to sail from Crete; then you would have spared yourselves this damage and loss.

verses.zh: 现在我还劝你们放心，你们的性命一个也不失丧，惟独失丧这船。
verses.en: But now I urge you to keep up your courage, because not one of you will be lost; only the ship will be destroyed.

verses.zh: 因我所属所事奉的神，他的使者昨夜站在我旁边，说：
verses.en: Last night an angel of the God to whom I belong and whom I serve stood beside me

verses.zh: 保罗，不要害怕，你必定站在凯撒面前，并且与你同船的人，神都赐给你了。
verses.en: and said, Do not be afraid, Paul. You must stand trial before Caesar; and God has graciously given you the lives of all who sail with you.

verses.zh: 所以诸位可以放心，我信神他怎样对我说，事情也要怎样成就。
verses.en: So keep up your courage, men, for I have faith in God that it will happen just as he told me.

verses.zh: 然而我们必要撞在一个岛上。
verses.en: Nevertheless, we must run aground on some island.

verses.zh: 到了第十四天夜间，船在亚得里亚海飘来飘去。约到半夜，水手以为渐近旱地，
verses.en: On the fourteenth night we were still being driven across the Adriatic Sea, when about midnight the sailors sensed they were approaching land.

verses.zh: 就探深浅，探得有十二丈，他们又探，探得有九丈。
verses.en: They took soundings and found that the water was a hundred and twenty feet deep. A short time later they took soundings again and found it was ninety feet deep.

verses.zh: 恐怕撞在石头上，就从船尾抛下四个锚，盼望天亮。
verses.en: Fearing that we would be dashed against the rocks, they dropped four anchors from the stern and prayed for daylight.

verses.zh: 水手想要逃出船去，把小船放在海里，假作要从船头抛锚的样子。
verses.en: In an attempt to escape from the ship, the sailors let the lifeboat down into the sea, pretending they were going to lower some anchors from the bow.

verses.zh: 保罗对百夫长和兵丁说：这些人若不等在船上，你们必不能得救。
verses.en: But Paul said to the centurion and the soldiers, Unless these men stay with the ship, you cannot be saved.

verses.zh: 于是兵丁砍断小船的绳子，任它飘去。
verses.en: So the soldiers cut the ropes that held the lifeboat and let it drift away.

verses.zh: 天快亮的时候，保罗劝众人吃食物，说：你们悬望忍耐，已经十四天了，一粒东西也没有吃。
verses.en: Just before dawn Paul urged them all to eat. For the last fourteen days, he said, you have been in constant suspense and have gone without food—you haven't eaten anything.

verses.zh: 所以我劝你们吃食物，这于你们是必要的，因为你们各人连一根头发也不至于损坏。
verses.en: Now I urge you to take some food. You need it to survive. Not one of you will lose a single hair from his head.

verses.zh: 说了这话，就拿着饼，在众人面前祝谢了神，擘开吃。
verses.en: After he said this, he took some bread and gave thanks to God in front of them all. Then he broke it and began to eat.

verses.zh: 于是他们都放下心，也就吃了。
verses.en: They were all encouraged and ate some food themselves.

verses.zh: 我们在船上的共有二百七十六个人。
verses.en: Altogether there were 276 of us on board.

verses.zh: 他们吃饱了，就把船上的麦子抛在海里，为要轻些船。
verses.en: When they had eaten as much as they wanted, they lightened the ship by throwing the grain into the sea.

verses.zh: 到了天亮，他们不认识那地方，但见一个海湾，有岸可登，就商议能把船拢进去不能。
verses.en: When daylight came, they did not recognize the land, but they saw a bay with a sandy beach, where they decided to run the ship aground if they could.

verses.zh: 于是砍断缆索，弃锚在海里，同时松开舵绳，拉起头篷，顺着风向岸行去。
verses.en: Cutting loose the anchors, they left them in the sea and at the same time untied the ropes that held the rudders. Then they hoisted the foresail to the wind and made for the beach.

verses.zh: 但遇着两水夹流的地方，就把船搁浅了。船头胶住不动，船尾被浪的猛力冲坏。
verses.en: But the ship struck a sandbar and ran aground. The bow stuck fast and would not move, and the stern was broken to pieces by the pounding of the surf.

verses.zh: 兵丁的意思要把囚犯杀了，恐怕有游泳脱逃的。
verses.en: The soldiers planned to kill the prisoners to prevent any of them from swimming away and escaping.

verses.zh: 但百夫长要救保罗，不准他们任意而行，就吩咐会游泳的，跳下水去先上岸。
verses.en: But the centurion wanted to spare Paul's life and kept them from carrying out their plan. He ordered those who could swim to jump overboard first and get to land.

verses.zh: 其余的人，用板子或船上的零碎东西上岸。这样，众人得救，都上了岸。
verses.en: The rest were to get there on planks or on other pieces of the ship. In this way everyone reached land safely.

verses.zh: 我们既已得救，才知道那岛名叫米利大。
verses.en: Once safely on shore, we found out that the island was called Malta.

verses.zh: 土人看待我们，有非常的情分，因为当时下雨，天气又冷，就生火接待我们众人。
verses.en: The islanders showed us unusual kindness. They built a fire and welcomed us all because it was raining and cold.

verses.zh: 那时，保罗拾起一捆柴，放在火上，有一条毒蛇，因为热了出来，咬住他的手。
verses.en: Paul gathered a pile of brushwood and, as he put it on the fire, a viper, driven out by the heat, fastened itself on his hand.

verses.zh: 土人看见那毒蛇悬在他手上，就彼此说：这人必是个凶手，虽然从海里救上来，天理还不容他活着。
verses.en: When the islanders saw the snake hanging from his hand, they said to each other, This man must be a murderer; for though he escaped from the sea, the goddess Justice has not allowed him to live.

verses.zh: 保罗竟把那毒蛇甩在火里，并没有受伤。
verses.en: But Paul shook the snake off into the fire and suffered no ill effects.

verses.zh: 土人想他必要肿起来，或是忽然仆倒死了。看了多时，见他无害，就转念说：他是个神。
verses.en: The people expected him to swell up or suddenly fall dead; but after waiting a long time and seeing nothing unusual happen to him, they changed their minds and said he was a god.

verses.zh: 离那地方不远，有田产是岛长部百流的。他接纳我们，尽情款待三日。
verses.en: There was an estate nearby that belonged to Publius, the chief official of the island. He welcomed us to his home and showed us generous hospitality for three days.

verses.zh: 当时，部百流的父亲患热病和痢疾躺着。保罗进去，为他祷告，按手在他头上，治好了他。
verses.en: His father was ill in bed, suffering from fever and dysentery. Paul went in to see him and, after prayer, placed his hands on him and healed him.

verses.zh: 从此，岛上其余的病人也来得了医治。
verses.en: When this had happened, the rest of the sick on the island came and were cured.

verses.zh: 他们又多方尊敬我们，到了开船的时候，也把我们所需用的送到船上。
verses.en: They honored us in many ways; and when we were ready to sail, they furnished us with the supplies we needed.

verses.zh: 过了三个月，我们上了亚力山太的船，船名叫丢斯双子，在那海岛过了冬。
verses.en: After three months we put out to sea in a ship that had wintered in the island—it was an Alexandrian ship with the figurehead of the twin gods Castor and Pollux.

verses.zh: 到了叙拉古，我们停泊三日。
verses.en: We put in at Syracuse and stayed there three days.

verses.zh: 又从那里绕行，来到利基翁。过了一天，南风大作，第二天就来到部丢利。
verses.en: From there we set sail and arrived at Rhegium. The next day the south wind came up, and on the second day we reached Puteoli.

verses.zh: 在那里遇见弟兄们，请我们与他们同住了七天。这样，我们来到罗马。
verses.en: There we found some brothers and sisters who invited us to spend a week with them. And so we came to Rome.

verses.zh: 那里的弟兄们，一听见我们的信息，就出来到亚比乌市和三馆地方迎接我们。保罗见了他们，就感谢神，放心壮胆。
verses.en: The brothers and sisters there had heard that we were coming, and they traveled as far as the Forum of Appius and the Three Taverns to meet us. At the sight of these people Paul thanked God and was encouraged.

verses.zh: 进了罗马城，保罗蒙准和一个看守他的兵同住。
verses.en: When we got to Rome, Paul was allowed to live by himself, with a soldier to guard him.

verses.zh: 过了三天，保罗请犹太人的首领来。他们来了，就对他们说：诸位弟兄，我虽没有作甚么事干犯本国的百姓和我们祖宗的规条，却被锁绑，从耶路撒冷解到罗马人的手里。
verses.en: Three days later he called together the local Jewish leaders. When they had assembled, Paul said to them: My brothers, although I have done nothing against our people or against the customs of our ancestors, I was arrested in Jerusalem and handed over to the Romans.

verses.zh: 他们审问了我，就愿意释放我，因为在我身上并没有该死的罪。
verses.en: They examined me and wanted to release me, because I was not guilty of any crime deserving death.

verses.zh: 无奈犹太人不服，我不得已，上告于凯撒，并非有甚么事要控告我本国的百姓。
verses.en: The Jews objected, so I was compelled to make an appeal to Caesar. I certainly did not intend to bring any charge against my own people.

verses.zh: 因此，我请你们来见见谈谈。我原为以色列人所指望的，被这链子捆锁。
verses.en: For this reason I have asked to see you and talk with you. It is because of the hope of Israel that I am bound with this chain.

verses.zh: 他们说：我们并没有接着从犹太来论你的信，也没有弟兄来报给我们说你有什么不好处。
verses.en: They replied, We have not received any letters from Judea concerning you, and none of our people who have come from there has reported or said anything bad about you.

verses.zh: 但我们愿意听你的意见如何，因为我们晓得这教门到处被毁谤。
verses.en: But we want to hear what your views are, for we know that people everywhere are talking against this sect.

verses.zh: 他们和保罗约定了日子，就有许多人到他的寓处来。保罗从早到晚，对他们讲论这事，证明神国的道，引摩西的律法和先知的书，以耶稣的事劝勉他们。
verses.en: They arranged to meet Paul on a certain day, and came in even larger numbers to the place where he was staying. He witnessed to them from morning till evening, explaining about the kingdom of God, and from the Law of Moses and from the Prophets he tried to persuade them about Jesus.

verses.zh: 有些人听了这话就信了，又有些人不信。
verses.en: Some were convinced by what he said, but others would not believe.

verses.zh: 他们彼此不合，就散了。未散以先，保罗说了一句话，说：圣灵借先知以赛亚向你们祖宗所说的话是不错的。
verses.en: They disagreed among themselves and began to leave after Paul had made this final statement: The Holy Spirit spoke the truth to your ancestors when he said through Isaiah the prophet:

verses.zh: 他说：你去对这百姓说，你们听是要听见，却不明白；看是要看见，却不晓得。
verses.en: Go to this people and say, You will be ever hearing but never understanding; you will be ever seeing but never perceiving.

verses.zh: 因为这百姓油蒙了心，耳朵发沉，眼睛闭着，恐怕眼睛看见，耳朵听见，心里明白，回转过来，我就医治他们。
verses.en: For this people's heart has become calloused; they hardly hear with their ears, and they have closed their eyes. Otherwise they might see with their eyes, hear with their ears, understand with their hearts and turn, and I would heal them.

verses.zh: 所以你们当知道，神这救恩，如今传给外邦人，他们也必听受。
verses.en: Therefore I want you to know that God's salvation has been sent to the Gentiles, and they will listen!

verses.zh: 保罗说了这话，犹太人议论纷纷地就走了。
verses.en: After he said this, the Jews left, arguing vigorously among themselves.

verses.zh: 保罗在自己所租的房子里住了足足两年。凡来见他的人，他都接待，
verses.en: For two whole years Paul stayed there in his own rented house and welcomed all who came to see him.

verses.zh: 放胆传讲神国的道，将主耶稣基督的事教导人，并没有人禁止。
verses.en: He proclaimed the kingdom of God and taught about the Lord Jesus Christ—with all boldness and without hindrance!
